         <title id="H7BD79C8390B64C008326344B9D1D93DE"
                 qb-display-quote="yes"
                 style="OLC">
            III
            RELATED AGENCIES
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="id40F22C399BF941FFAC2310A42C04DB92"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8AD181DCA906435F88D139ED7EE4CFD7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  Access Board
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H086C8D0B6EF242DE8E17EC2F084F8E08"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  SALARIES AND EXPENSES
                  For expenses necessary for the Access Board, as authorized by section 502 of the
       Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C.
        792), $9,955,000: Provided, That, notwithstanding any other
       provision of law, there may be credited to this appropriation funds received for publications
       and training expenses. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD216103112C04D73BA6FB85A230CFF92"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  Federal maritime commission
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H655BDE80ABCE42128798A6460FFB08E6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  SALARIES AND EXPENSES
                  For necessary expenses of the Federal Maritime Commission as authorized by section 46107
       of title 46, United States Code, including services as authorized by section 3109 of title 5,
       United States Code; hire of passenger motor vehicles as authorized by section 1343(b) of
       title 31, United States Code; and uniforms or allowances therefor, as authorized by sections
       5901 and 5902 of title 5, United States Code, $40,000,000, of which $2,000,000 shall remain
       available until September 30, 2025: Provided, That not to exceed $3,500
       shall be for official reception and representation expenses. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H274DCBFBC681411AA5DF5B66E8709E92"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  National railroad passenger corporation
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5333236351294A208E8991C96369308F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  Office of inspector general
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD9E3E330A07F4649B1A62B739E9FE340"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  SALARIES AND EXPENSES
                  For necessary expenses of the Office of Inspector General for the National Railroad
       Passenger Corporation to carry out the provisions of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5
       U.S.C. App. 3), $29,240,000: Provided, That the Inspector General shall have
       all necessary authority, in carrying out the duties specified in such Act, to investigate
       allegations of fraud, including false statements to the Government under section 1001 of
       title 18, United States Code, by any person or entity that is subject to regulation by the
       National Railroad Passenger Corporation: Provided further, That the
       Inspector General may enter into contracts and other arrangements for audits, studies,
       analyses, and other services with public agencies and with private persons, subject to the
       applicable laws and regulations that govern the obtaining of such services within the
       National Railroad Passenger Corporation: Provided further, That the
       Inspector General may select, appoint, and employ such officers and employees as may be
       necessary for carrying out the functions, powers, and duties of the Office of Inspector
       General, subject to the applicable laws and regulations that govern such selections,
       appointments, and employment within the National Railroad Passenger Corporation:
        Provided further, That concurrent with the President’s budget request for
       fiscal year 2025, the Inspector General shall submit to the House and Senate Committees on
       Appropriations a budget request for fiscal year 2025 in similar 
                        138 STAT. 388
                      format and substance to
       budget requests submitted by executive agencies of the Federal Government. 
                  
                     Contracts.
                  
                  
                     Budget request.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBF67199171104AEDAF020D31DB24409C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  National transportation safety board
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCE896A76FB564B10A44101E4EB604E4A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  SALARIES AND EXPENSES
                  For necessary expenses of the National Transportation Safety Board, including hire of
       passenger motor vehicles and aircraft; services as authorized by section 3109 of title 5,
       United States Code, but at rates for individuals not to exceed the per diem rate equivalent
       to the rate for a GS–15; uniforms, or allowances therefor, as authorized by sections 5901 and
       5902 of title 5, United States Code, $140,000,000, of which not to exceed $1,000 may be used
       for official reception and representation expenses.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1E3D116573C5483E8FFE5E2F14B7D337"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  Neighborhood reinvestment corporation
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2145C161C15D4968AD5225774CAA8B27"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  PAYMENT TO THE NEIGHBORHOOD REINVESTMENT CORPORATION
                  For payment to the Neighborhood Reinvestment Corporation for use in neighborhood
       reinvestment activities, as authorized by the Neighborhood Reinvestment Corporation Act
        (42 U.S.C. 8101–8107),
       $158,000,000.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9841B40B720648B38152885625718535"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  Surface transportation board
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDB4CCBF4C11F40F989A4C9B5C7FE61FB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  SALARIES AND EXPENSES
                  For necessary expenses of the Surface Transportation Board, including services
       authorized by section 3109 of title 5, United States Code, $47,452,000:
        Provided, That, notwithstanding any other provision of law, not to exceed
       $1,250,000 from fees established by the Surface Transportation Board shall be credited to
       this appropriation as offsetting collections and used for necessary and authorized expenses
       under this heading: Provided further, That the amounts made available under
       this heading from the general fund shall be reduced on a dollar-for-dollar basis as such
       offsetting collections are received during fiscal year 2024, to result in a final
       appropriation from the general fund estimated at not more than $46,202,000.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HABB82D7547414E969484B3F0C72273A5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  United states interagency council on homelessness

                  OPERATING EXPENSES
                  For necessary expenses, including payment of salaries, authorized travel, hire of
       passenger motor vehicles, the rental of conference rooms, and the employment of experts and

       Interagency Council on Homelessness in carrying out the functions pursuant to title II of the
       McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act, as amended, $4,300,000.
               
            
         
         <title id="H5A842D0019BA41629D6DFD1BB58D19B4"
                 qb-display-quote="yes"
                 style="OLC">
            
               138 STAT. 389
            
            IV
            GENERAL PROVISIONS—THIS ACT
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H999989AAB00B4AF9854DB574160460CE"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               401.
               None of the funds in this Act shall be used for the planning or execution of any program
      to pay the expenses of, or otherwise compensate, non-Federal parties intervening in regulatory
      or adjudicatory proceedings funded in this Act.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HE5CEB35F4F024D768FC8979423C11D11"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               402.
               None of the funds appropriated in this Act shall remain available for obligation beyond
      the current fiscal year, nor may any be transferred to other appropriations, unless expressly
      so provided herein. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H105A9144F4E041198A289731AFFBF45C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               403.
               The expenditure of any appropriation under this Act for any consulting service through a
      procurement contract pursuant to section 3109 of title 5, United States Code, shall be limited
      to those contracts where such expenditures are a matter of public record and available for
      public inspection, except where otherwise provided under existing law, or under existing
      Executive Order issued pursuant to existing law. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC4ACB67BF30A44B8A95C381BFD968B84"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               404.
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDA518E6C795043159B1C7062776AC1E6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  None of the funds made available in this Act may be obligated or expended for any
       employee training that—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H233C4A38FC434F6AAF48BB8ECF943D79"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     does not meet identified needs for knowledge, skills, and abilities bearing directly
        upon the performance of official duties;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCEBDDB39DC2142948AE38A23D5E946D1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     contains elements likely to induce high levels of emotional response or psychological
        stress in some participants;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H12E7D40558DA4E4F92CCCE48132DB111"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     does not require prior employee notification of the content and methods to be used in
        the training and written end of course evaluation;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9EFBD93F3E5A44B49AD2D1B6015FC410"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     contains any methods or content associated with religious or quasi-religious belief
        systems or <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">new age belief systems as defined in Equal Employment Opportunity
        Commission Notice N–915.022, dated September 2, 1988; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD3F743A187F245D6808FE2D1B0CDC42A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     is offensive to, or designed to change, participants' personal values or lifestyle
        outside the workplace.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6E93A704C1054BE09CB182A99B4FB469"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Nothing in this section shall prohibit, restrict, or otherwise preclude an agency from
       conducting training bearing directly upon the performance of official duties.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HE21AEC45298E4F15A7804B05CF367507"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               405.
               Except as otherwise provided in this Act, none of the funds provided in this Act,
      provided by previous appropriations Acts to the agencies or entities funded in this Act that
      remain available for obligation or expenditure in fiscal year 2024, or provided from any
      accounts in the Treasury derived by the collection of fees and available to the agencies
      funded by this Act, shall be available for obligation or expenditure through a reprogramming
      of funds that—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5CD6E71AA4544E4A8EEDC0FE81D386D9"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  creates a new program;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA2406C61C0624773AC6E19B5E54E47B8"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  eliminates a program, project, or activity;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H27B56EC5CE104D06B23981F502BF60DF"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  increases funds or personnel for any program, project, or activity for which funds have
       been denied or restricted by the Congress;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H78A595BB6EE74EB29CF574F8BB6DFD72"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  proposes to use funds directed for a specific activity by either the House or Senate
       Committees on Appropriations for a different purpose;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1ED113AAB5E1405EB30E000FD6038952"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  augments existing programs, projects, or activities in excess of $5,000,000 or 10
       percent, whichever is less;
                  
                     138 STAT. 390
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H523B342379984C01B866B3EE04E9A112"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  reduces existing programs, projects, or activities by $5,000,000 or 10 percent,
       whichever is less; or
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE80BC81C276E4EDE80DE66E3FC49791F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  creates, reorganizes, or restructures a branch, division, office, bureau, board,
       commission, agency, administration, or department different from the budget justifications
       submitted to the Committees on Appropriations or the table accompanying the explanatory
       statement described in section 4 (in the matter preceding division A of this consolidated
       Act), whichever is more detailed, unless prior approval is received from the House and Senate
       Committees on Appropriations:
                  
                     Advance approval.
                  
                  
                     Provided, That not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this
       Act, each agency funded by this Act shall submit a report to the Committees on Appropriations
       of the Senate and of the House of Representatives to establish the baseline for application
       of reprogramming and transfer authorities for the current fiscal year: Provided
        further, That the report shall include—
                  
                     Contracts.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H12A979880FC24720A07A798A6766A588"
                           indent="subparagraph"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (A)
                  a table for each appropriation with a separate column to display the prior year enacted
       level, the President's budget request, adjustments made by Congress, adjustments due to
       enacted rescissions, if appropriate, and the fiscal year enacted level;
                  
                     Reports.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H428C5791B6DE4C0EBBB1509566E31F54"
                           indent="subparagraph"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (B)
                  a delineation in the table for each appropriation and its respective prior year enacted
       level by object class and program, project, and activity as detailed in this Act, the table
       accompanying the explanatory statement described in section 4 (in the matter preceding
       division A of this consolidated Act), accompanying reports of the House and Senate Committees
       on Appropriations, or in the budget appendix for the respective appropriations, whichever is
       more detailed, and shall apply to all items for which a dollar amount is specified and to all
       programs for which new budget (obligational) authority is provided, as well as to
       discretionary grants and discretionary grant allocations; and
                  
                     Applicability.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD4C846FD883D41F088E30779EF8A38F9"
                           indent="subparagraph"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (C)
                  an identification of items of special congressional interest. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H0B37BDE120E146499E7451DF1C294331"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               406.
               Except as otherwise specifically provided by law, not to exceed 50 percent of unobligated
      balances remaining available at the end of fiscal year 2024 from appropriations made available
      for salaries and expenses for fiscal year 2024 in this Act, shall remain available through
      September 30, 2025, for each such account for the purposes authorized:
       Provided, That a request shall be submitted to the House and Senate
      Committees on Appropriations for approval prior to the expenditure of such funds:
       Provided further, That these requests shall be made in compliance with
      reprogramming guidelines under section 405 of this Act. 
               
                  Advance approval. Expenditure requests.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H9A82A303643D442C8440BFE8854B680F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               407.
               No funds in this Act may be used to support any Federal, State, or local projects that
      seek to use the power of eminent domain, unless eminent domain is employed only for a public
      use: Provided, That for purposes of this section, public use shall not be
      construed to include economic development that primarily benefits private entities:
       Provided further, That any use of funds for mass transit, railroad, airport,
      seaport or highway projects, as well as utility projects which benefit or serve the general
      public (including energy-related, communication-related, water-related and wastewater-related
      infrastructure), other structures designated for use by the general public or which have other
        
                     138 STAT. 391
                  
      common-carrier or public-utility functions that serve the general public and are subject to
      regulation and oversight by the government, and projects for the removal of an immediate
      threat to public health and safety or brownfields as defined in the Small Business Liability
      Relief and Brownfields Revitalization Act (Public Law
       107–118) shall be considered a public use for purposes of eminent domain. 
               
                  Eminent domain.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HEFFF5661FBD945BAAC69B190A39A8339"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               408.
               None of the funds made available in this Act may be transferred to any department,
      agency, or instrumentality of the United States Government, except pursuant to a transfer made
      by, or transfer authority provided in, this Act or any other appropriations Act.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD4D6193068D847E4840C8DC7FE489574"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               409.
               No funds appropriated pursuant to this Act may be expended by an entity unless the entity
      agrees that in expending the assistance the entity will comply with sections 2 through 4 of
      the Act of March 3, 1933 (41 U.S.C.
       8301–8305, popularly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Buy American Act).
               
                  Compliance.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HAEE020F487F3480E92AAFC3E02B2A495"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               410.
               No funds appropriated or otherwise made available under this Act shall be made available
      to any person or entity that has been convicted of violating the Buy American Act (41 U.S.C. 8301–8305).
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HE57B3E1EBAA9404AA5A46FC37C24F42B"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               411.
               None of the funds made available in this Act may be used for first-class airline
      accommodations in contravention of sections 301–10.122 and 301–10.123 of title 41, Code of
      Federal Regulations. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD5025BC72AEE465CB22E10E72252907D"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               412.
               None of the funds made available in this Act may be used to send or otherwise pay for the
      attendance of more than 50 employees of a single agency or department of the United States
      Government, who are stationed in the United States, at any single international conference
      unless the relevant Secretary reports to the House and Senate Committees on Appropriations at
      least 5 days in advance that such attendance is important to the national interest:
       Provided, That for purposes of this section the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">international
       conference shall mean a conference occurring outside of the United States attended by
      representatives of the United States Government and of foreign governments, international
      organizations, or nongovernmental organizations.
               
                  Definition.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H939CA890C730428B829E92768622F15C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               413.
               None of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available under this Act may be used by
      the Surface Transportation Board to charge or collect any filing fee for rate or practice
      complaints filed with the Board in an amount in excess of the amount authorized for district
      court civil suit filing fees under section 1914 of title 28, United States Code. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H18708D1EF9C744C4BCBB6C9439B73D17"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               414.
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD5C3A880A824474EA48CC74611572155"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  None of the funds made available in this Act may be used to maintain or establish a
       computer network unless such network blocks the viewing, downloading, and exchanging of
       pornography.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H30382E2840564C69B529F8C8715781CB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Nothing in subsection (a) shall limit the use of funds necessary for any Federal, State,
       tribal, or local law enforcement agency or any other entity carrying out criminal
       investigations, prosecution, or adjudication activities. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H874928696865494C8B5DC6F16C4C082E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               415.
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8E1826BC21F04F15849D87F6572E246A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  None of the funds made available in this Act may be used to deny an Inspector General
       funded under this Act timely access to any records, documents, or other materials available
       to the department or agency over which that Inspector General has responsibilities under the
       Inspector General Act of 
                        138 STAT.
         392
                      1978 (5 U.S.C. App.), or to prevent or impede that Inspector
       General's access to such records, documents, or other materials, under any provision of law,
       except a provision of law that expressly refers to the Inspector General and expressly limits
       the Inspector General's right of access.
                  
                     Records.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAE5F31C759A94563824E94AD4D5FE69A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  A department or agency covered by this section shall provide its Inspector General with
       access to all such records, documents, and other materials in a timely manner.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB8C59B1B71F94D57805738543D45FBCE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Each Inspector General shall ensure compliance with statutory limitations on disclosure
       relevant to the information provided by the establishment over which that Inspector General
       has responsibilities under the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.).
                  
                     Compliance.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H96AAD437C9BB4D14866A715E336723AD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Each Inspector General covered by this section shall report to the Committees on
       Appropriations of the House of Representatives and the Senate within 5 calendar days any
       failures to comply with this requirement. 
                  
                     Reports. Compliance.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HF0A8E88937B04EF188B453828A92D466"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               416.
               None of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available by this Act may be used to pay
      award or incentive fees for contractors whose performance has been judged to be below
      satisfactory, behind schedule, over budget, or has failed to meet the basic requirements of a
      contract, unless the Agency determines that any such deviations are due to unforeseeable
      events, government-driven scope changes, or are not significant within the overall scope of
      the project and/or program unless such awards or incentive fees are consistent with
      16.401(e)(2) of the Federal Acquisition Regulations. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H84EE281C59B84BB88A80ADEB655FEDB2"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               417.
               No part of any appropriation contained in this Act shall be available to pay the salary
      for any person filling a position, other than a temporary position, formerly held by an
      employee who has left to enter the Armed Forces of the United States and has satisfactorily
      completed his or her period of active military or naval service, and has within 90 days after
      his or her release from such service or from hospitalization continuing after discharge for a
      period of not more than 1 year, made application for restoration to his or her former position
      and has been certified by the Office of Personnel Management as still qualified to perform the
      duties of his or her former position and has not been restored thereto.
               
                  Deadline. Time period. Certification.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H6EFE300E5F7042A18978AA3B6B3C052D"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               418.
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD106E201CD784045BD98D4C78C650D86"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  None of the funds made available by this Act may be used to approve a new foreign air
       carrier permit under sections 41301 through 41305 of title 49, United States Code, or
       exemption application under section 40109 of that title of an air carrier already holding an
       air operators certificate issued by a country that is party to the U.S.-E.U.-Iceland-Norway
       Air Transport Agreement where such approval would contravene United States law or Article 17
       bis of the U.S.-E.U.-Iceland-Norway Air Transport Agreement.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE7935B0958F54B9C8B0C08B509C92A0F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Nothing in this section shall prohibit, restrict or otherwise preclude the Secretary of
       Transportation from granting a foreign air carrier permit or an exemption to such an air
       carrier where such authorization is consistent with the U.S.-E.U.-Iceland-Norway Air
       Transport Agreement and United States law. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H47954521BAB94675BB340E07736E5A81"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               419.
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0E6E19CA084441A39555D5481FC376F9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In the table of projects in the explanatory statement referenced in section 417 of the
       Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2022
       (division L of Public Law 117–103)—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6558FCEE891242DD8293F34297D0F829"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the item relating to <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Midland Center for the Arts only for structural
         improvements is deemed to be amended by 
                           138 STAT. 393
                         striking recipient <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">City of
         Midland and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Midland Center for the Arts;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFC6CC53653D84DDA909F6725BB18134A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the item relating to <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB9CC0E9D91CA4BD8B86BC742FEC16A52"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               420.
               None of the funds made available by this Act may be used by the Secretary of Housing and
      Urban Development in contravention of section 312 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief
      and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C.
       5155).
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4226D17A6DF3487DB61F59AE5C976249"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               421.
               None of the funds made available by this Act to the Department of Transportation may be
      used in contravention of section 306108 of title 54, United States Code.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD8F48BFB18C44DD39F39E78EC26890FF"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               422.
               None of the funds made available by this or any other Act may be used to require the use
      of inward facing cameras or require a motor carrier to register an apprenticeship program with
      the Department of Labor as a condition for participation in the safe driver apprenticeship
      pilot program.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H072699F5FE674756BAAB5599E107E003"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               423.
               None of the funds made available by this Act may be used by the Department of Housing and
      Urban Development to direct a grantee to undertake specific changes to existing zoning laws as
      part of carrying out the final rule entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Affirmatively Furthering Fair
       Housing (80 Fed. Reg. 42272 (July 16, 2015)) or the notice entitled
       <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing Assessment Tool (79 Fed. Reg. 57949
      (September 26, 2014)).
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4B114C69CDBA458FA44F9FC7EF607B70"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               424.
               None of the funds made available by this Act may be used in contravention of existing
      Federal law regarding non-citizen eligibility and ineligibility for occupancy in federally
      assisted housing or for participation in and assistance under Federal housing programs,
      including section 214 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1980 (42 U.S.C. 1436a) and title IV of the Personal
      Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 (8 U.S.C. 1601 et seq.).
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H571B7BF411E64B2A94AE555D2B32C12A"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               425.
               Section 127 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by inserting at the end the
      following:
               
                  Permits.
               
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H3B68DE69D86348A79155240C8A5A867E"
                              style="OLC">
                  <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HDB651C68B138473AB2C5BF8F406F5A5A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (x)
                     Certain agricultural vehicles in the state of mississippi
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6D0F9E5C8BAA4CDCB7635FBC8D261A56"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The State of Mississippi may allow, by special permit, the operation of a covered
        agricultural vehicle on the Interstate System in the State of Mississippi if such vehicle
        does not exceed—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7103CC33354342C8A632AA1418A6DF62"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        a gross vehicle weight of 88,000 pounds; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H365BD06DCC9D48D59E389632A54B88A1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        110 percent of the maximum weight on any axle or axle group described in subsection
         (a)(2), including any enforcement tolerance.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H002E2A7A67644C88A52FD3EF3B0E3598"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Covered agricultural vehicle defined
                     In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">covered agricultural vehicle means a
        vehicle that is transporting unprocessed agricultural crops used for food, feed or fiber, or
        raw or unfinished forest products, including logs, pulpwood, biomass or wood chips.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H6DA1492B1A1644CCBFF61BD876F4E587"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (y)
                     Operation of certain vehicles in west virginia
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8EDDDE6D55034AFF8547FB59174291DD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        The State of West Virginia may allow, by special permit, the operation of a vehicle
         that is transporting materials and equipment on the Interstate 
                              138 STAT. 396
                            System in the State of West
         Virginia if such vehicle does not exceed 110 percent of the maximum weight on any axle or
         axle group described in subsection (a)(2), including any enforcement tolerance, provided
         the remaining gross vehicle weight requirements of subsection (a) are met.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8CD9BA07C6C64B2D89FD8CCF9FA11BD7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Definition
                        In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">materials and equipment means materials
         and equipment that are used on a project eligible under this chapter.
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HE9862B555B214C999516A26365341F3B"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               426.
               None of the funds appropriated or made available by this division for the Department of
      Transportation for fiscal year 2024 may be used to enforce a mask mandate in response to the
      COVID–19 virus.
               
                  Mask mandate.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="id39F3FC72B94149798F890B381335F51B"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE9A0ED9A4528421D845B3A17A20171F0"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  
                  This division may be cited as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Transportation, Housing and Urban Development,
        and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2024.

         following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H01D5455CA23B42EFA03DDD3F189B525E"

                                          id="H65582D96348246D9AF0E9FFD47289260"

           1, 2023, and ending on December 31, 2024, the Secretary may use any amounts made
           available in any fiscal year to carry out this section (including amounts recouped under
           subsection (f)) to make payments described in paragraphs (1)(A) and (1)(B), in addition
           to the total amount of funds appropriated under subsection (g).
                           
                           .

                                 id="H2EEB554729F0463DB191F522ED3EB2B9"

         Secretary of Health and Human Services shall submit to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

         of the Senate a report specifying—

          Health Service Act (42 U.S.C.
          256h);

          were used pursuant to subsection (b)(2)(C) of such section 340H to adjust total payment

          amended by paragraph (3).

         117–328 for funds for programs authorized under sections 330 through 340 of the
        Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 254b et
         seq.).

                       style="OLC">
               B
               Medicaid
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HDBF34FB4E0FB4C11B6742C4DC6694B86"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  201.
                  REQUIREMENT FOR STATE MEDICAID PLANS TO PROVIDE COVERAGE FOR MEDICATION-ASSISTED
       TREATMENT
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HBE32570A6A024B3FB08957C19E1412E7"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     
                        138 STAT. 153
                     
                     (a)
                     In general
                     Section 1905 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d) is amended—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H92743D1931654175AD500F5E7F11986D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        in subsection (a)(29), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">for the period beginning October 1, 2020,
          and ending September 30, 2025, and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">beginning on October 1,
          2020,; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB0BC2DCDDCD74998837AACC74D2DCCC6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        in subsection (ee)(2), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"

          if before the beginning of such period the State certifies to the satisfaction of the
          Secretary and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"

          years and to the satisfaction of the Secretary,.
                        
                           Certification.

                     Section 1006(b)(4)(A) of the Substance Use-Disorder Prevention that Promotes Opioid

         October 1, 2025. 
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD9866B4CEE214158BDD444FDB5BF552D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  202.
                  COLLECTION AND REPORTING OF COMPREHENSIVE DATA FOR SPECIFIED POPULATIONS ENROLLED IN
       MEDICAID AND CHIP
                  Title XIX of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396 et seq.) is amended by adding
       at the end the following new section: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HEEB1D00BFB68457E85248A0454C556E0"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H5F893309314C4852BB21D6C7F2C45338"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        1948.
                        COLLECTION AND REPORTING OF COMPREHENSIVE DATA FOR SPECIFIED POPULATIONS
                        
                           42 USC 1396w-8.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H81AAEAB98574467FB95FC19167D06436"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           Recurring analysis and publication of health care data related to treatment for
          substance use disorder or a mental health condition
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD59AE061385C4D288ABE71981C7E420C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              
                                 Public information. Web posting.
                              
                              The Secretary, on an annual basis, shall link, analyze, and publish on a publicly
           available website data reported by States through the Transformed Medicaid Statistical
           Information System (T–MSIS) (or a successor system) relating to substance use disorder
           and mental health services provided to individuals enrolled under a State plan under this
           title or a State child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans) who
           have been diagnosed with a substance use disorder or mental health condition, including
           an analysis that is disaggregated by age. Such enrollee information shall be
           de-identified of any personally identifying information, shall adhere to privacy
           standards established by the Department of Health and Human Services, and shall be
           aggregated to protect the privacy of enrollees, as necessary. 
                              
                                 Privacy.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCCC254476075430EABF3110E715A6881"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Requirements
                              
                                 District of Columbia. Territories.
                              
                              The analysis required under paragraph (1) shall include, at a minimum, the following
           data for each State (including, to the extent available, for the District of Columbia,
           Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and
           American Samoa): 
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H9BC5F4677D0344B5B5B1866EE2F2B2EE"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 The number and percentage of individuals enrolled under the State plan under this
            title or the State child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans)
            in each of the major enrollment categories (as 
                                       138 STAT. 400
                                     defined in a public letter from the
            Medicaid and CHIP Payment and Access Commission to the Secretary) who have been
            diagnosed with—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA73FFD9CFFA044C692F1C378333592B9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    a substance use disorder; 
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1A828D7183C9406498C1CD8E3B8E127E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    a mental health condition; or
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9E24CE7B382F44F1BA585A6789048071"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    a co-occurring substance use disorder and mental health condition. 
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5C9FB95F0DAB4D399C414643832FEEAE"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 With respect to individuals enrolled under the State plan under this title or the
            State child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans) who have
            received a diagnosis described in subparagraph (A), a list of the substance use disorder
            and mental health treatment services, including, to the extent such data are available,
            specific adult and pediatric services by each major type of service, such as counseling,
            intensive home-based services, intensive care coordination, crisis services tailored to
            children and youth, peer support services, family-to-family support, inpatient
            hospitalization, medication-assisted treatment, residential treatment, and other
            appropriate services as identified by the Secretary, for which beneficiaries in each
            State received at least 1 service under the State plan under this title or the State
            child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans). 
                                 
                                    List.
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H31F09654B5B046D2A2FBB4FEF8659831"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 With respect to each diagnosis described in subparagraph (A), the number and
            percentage of individuals enrolled under the State plan under this title or the State
            child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans) who have such
            diagnosis and received services for such diagnosis under such plan or waiver by each
            major type of treatment service listed under subparagraph (B) within each major setting
            type, such as outpatient, inpatient, residential, and other home-based and
            community-based settings.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HFA199507C03146D4B383164861029092"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 The number of services provided under the State plan under this title or the State
            child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans) per individual
            enrolled under such plan or waiver who has a diagnosis described in subparagraph (A) for
            each such diagnosis and each major type of treatment service listed under subparagraph
            (B).
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HCE8F8DD4E9104F56850E183C00719D0F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 The number and percentage of individuals enrolled under the State plan under this
            title or the State child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans)
            by major enrollment category, who have a diagnosis described in subparagraph (A) and
            received substance use disorder or mental health treatment through—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9BA8C9C055B9415CBF3974CEEBA6FD6B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    a Medicaid managed care entity (as defined in section 1932(a)(1)(B)), including
             the number of such individuals who received such assistance through a prepaid inpatient
             health plan (as defined by the Secretary) or a prepaid ambulatory health plan (as
             defined by the Secretary);
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H010577517172445ABC782C4138418ADE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    a fee-for-service payment model; or
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H88E298C3C5BF42988FED9A4ACA7E0C8E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    an alternative payment model, to the extent available.
                                    
                                       138 STAT. 401
                                    
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE3A70B450C05468C954948344A7E4C23"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (F)
                                 The number and percentage of individuals enrolled under the State plan under this
            title or the State child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans)
            who have a diagnosis described in subparagraph (A) and received services for a mental
            health condition or a substance use disorder in an outpatient or community-based or
            home-based setting after receiving mental health or substance use disorder services in
            an inpatient or residential setting, and the number of mental health or substance use
            disorder services received by such individuals in the outpatient or community-based or
            home-based setting. 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H95E3FEF3D860468F8E97257924F32CB4"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (G)
                                 The number and percentage of inpatient admissions in which services for a mental
            health condition or substance use disorder were provided to an individual enrolled under
            the State plan under this title or the State child health plan under title XXI (or under
            a waiver of such plans) that occurred within 30 days after discharge from a hospital or
            residential facility in which services for a mental health condition or substance use
            disorder previously were provided to such individual, disaggregated by each diagnosis
            described in subparagraph (A) and type of facility, to the extent such information is
            available. 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H507E5CC0F7D944B8BB7CBC0869F051E3"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (H)
                                 The number of emergency department visits by an individual enrolled under the State
            plan under this title or the State child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver
            of such plans) who has a diagnosis described in subparagraph (A) within 7 days of such
            individual being discharged from an inpatient stay at a hospital during which services
            for a mental health condition or substance use disorder were provided, or from a mental
            health facility, an independent psychiatric wing of an acute care hospital, an
            intermediate care facility for individuals with intellectual disabilities, or a
            residential treatment facility, disaggregated by each diagnosis described in
            subparagraph (A) and type of facility, to the extent such information is available.
           
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H43DA3317976F4CFBB3495E5CE7B09FA2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 The number and percentage of individuals who are enrolled under the State plan
            under this title or the State child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of
            such plans) and received an assessment for a mental health condition.
                                 
                                    Assessments.
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HFE3C7A7055104AEA933EA49CF54A7456"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (J)
                                 The number and percentage of individuals who are enrolled under the State plan
            under this title or the State child health plan under title XXI (or under a waiver of
            such plans) and received an assessment for a substance use disorder.
                                 
                                    Assessments.
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H222250D76280410C84CC8E15CA76EC8F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">

            State plan under this title or the State child health plan under title XXI (or under a
            waiver of such plans) who received an assessment described in subparagraph (I) in the 30
            days post-assessment.
                                 
                                    Assessments.

            title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans) who received 
                                       138 STAT. 402
                                     an assessment described
            in subparagraph (J) in the 30 days post-assessment. 
                                 
                                    Contracts. Determination.
                                 
                                 
                                    Assessments.
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H89FC279582774A289D3B83BEF0495C74"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (M)
                                 Prescription National Drug Code codes, fill dates, and number of days supply of any
            covered outpatient drug (as defined in section 1927(k)(2)) that was dispensed to an
            individual enrolled under the State plan under this title or the State child health plan
            under title XXI (or under a waiver of such plans) with an episode described in
            subparagraph (G) or (H) during any period that occurs after the individual’s discharge
            date defined in subparagraph (G) or (H) (as applicable), and before the admission date
            applicable under subparagraph (G) or the date of the emergency department visit
            applicable under subparagraph (H) that were—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)

                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HD393CF370B2F477C9ADECE00E00A7F80"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Publication
                           
                              Deadlines.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2394A410D49C43B5A6F28F4B169AA661"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              
                                 Public information. Analysis.
                              
                              Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary
           shall make publicly available the first analysis required by subsection (a). 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H803FB42CC2744476AB38C7C0FF737D66"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Annual updates
                              The Secretary shall issue an updated version of the analysis required under
           subsection (a) not later than January 1 of each calendar year.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE68B2D8036684FE7AF1E37B99F69166A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Use of T–MSIS data
                              The analysis required under subsection (a) and updates required under paragraph (4)
           shall—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H272987C546B54D0983C4391FA9081169"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 use data and definitions from the T–MSIS data set that is no more than 12 months
            old on the date that the analysis or update is published; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7F926A7DA4534F09B7385BC2D6C1F1CD"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 as appropriate, include a description with respect to each State of the quality and
            completeness of the data and caveats describing the limitations of the data reported to
            the Secretary by the State that is sufficient to communicate the appropriate uses for
            the information. 
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCF4C533043EC452ABCB3AA42628FCA0C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Revised publication
                              Beginning not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this section, the
           Secretary annually shall publish a revised publication of the analysis required by
           subsection (a) that allows for a research-ready and publicly accessible interface of the
           publication and is developed after consultation with stakeholders on the usability of the
           data contained in the publication.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD1C7A14EB633405BA2741A403069EE26"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (5)
                              Making t-msis data on substance use disorders and mental health conditions
           available to researchers
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H47F2EC211D4C4F7187631DF33293865D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 Requirement to publish system of records notice
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA063E770B2144D7CBB4D432056620684"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    In general
                                    
                                       Federal Register, publication.
                                    
                                    Subject to subparagraph (B), the Secretary shall publish in the Federal Register a
             system of records notice for the data specified in clause (ii) for the Transformed
             Medicaid Statistical Information System, in accordance with section 552a(e)(4) of title
             5, United States Code. The notice shall outline policies that protect the security and
             privacy of the data that, at a minimum, meet the security and privacy policies of SORN
             09-70-0541 for the Medicaid Statistical Information System.
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBE738E6413EE4DB0A73341A3BBCDEB9F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    Required data
                                    
                                       District of Columbia. Territories.
                                    
                                    The data covered by the systems of records notice required under clause (i) shall
             be sufficient for researchers and States to analyze 
                                          138 STAT. 403
                                        the prevalence of conditions
             described in subsection (a)(2)(A) in the Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance
             Program beneficiary population and the treatment of such conditions under Medicaid
             across all States (including the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the United States
             Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa), forms of
             treatment, and treatment settings. 
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBC595FBA905C4908839FA816DB8C96F8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    Initiation of data-sharing activities
                                    Not later than January 1, 2025, the Secretary shall initiate the data-sharing
             activities outlined in the notice required under clause (i).
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA486906C3277418DAB84AD8755208527"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Satisfaction of requirement through existing system of records notice
                                 The Secretary shall not be required to publish a new system of records notice as
            required under subparagraph (A) if, not later than January 1, 2025, the Secretary
            determines that the system of records notice published by the Secretary in the Federal
            Register on February 6, 2019 (84 Fed. Reg. 2230), satisfies the requirements described
            in subparagraph (A).
                                 
                                    Determination.
                                 
                              
                           
                        
                     
                     .

                     (d)
                     Application to certain States
                     
                        Effective dates. 42 USC 1396n note.
                     
                     Notwithstanding section 430.20 of title 42, Code of Federal Regulations, the Secretary
        of Health and Human Services may approve a request to renew a State plan amendment under
        section 1915(l) of the Social Security Act (42
         U.S.C. 1396n(l)) with an effective date of October 1, 2023, if the State making
        such request— 
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE5ADB3790D6640089D13F60561343B29"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        had approval for a State plan amendment under such section as of September 30, 2023;
         and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H13F8E3F72EF64510940EBF7AD445BAFC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        submits the request to renew such amendment not later than 60 days after the date of
         enactment of this Act. 
                        
                           Deadline.
                        
                     
                  
               
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H0C38D193946B47C3A0A6C27945DA4975"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">

          117–328), is further amended—

           (nn)(2));

                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H826FB55D120D4FDA82C366C28E814AB3"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
