                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Authority of President
                     The President is authorized to bring into force and implement the 2023 U.S.-Palau
        Compact Review Agreement.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD2D546B4F9924E429BDAD6BDF9B35DC9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Amendments, changes, or termination to compacts and certain agreements
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5DCB54CEA6004F15A7DB1A8012BF7C24"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Any amendment to, change to, or termination of all or any part of the 2023 Amended
        U.S.-FSM Compact, 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact, or the U.S.-Palau Compact, by mutual
        agreement or unilateral action of the Government of the United States, shall not enter into
        force until the date on which Congress has incorporated the applicable amendment, change, or
        termination into an Act of Congress.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H37F9EFA95E4E46F7A378C6B505E3855A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Additional actions and agreements
                     
                        Applicability.
                     
                     In addition to the Compacts described in paragraph (1), the requirements of that
        paragraph shall apply to—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7B3AA35BF0DF49138DD54AC48FC783FE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        any action of the Government of the United States under the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM
         Compact, 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact, or U.S.-Palau Compact, including an action taken
         pursuant to section 431, 441, or 442 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact, 2023 Amended
         U.S.-RMI Compact, or U.S.-Palau Compact; and
                        
                           138 STAT. 424
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H88162C3CDBD34425978D55EBC0E27DD5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        any amendment to, change to, or termination of—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB13E2D2274084CBBAAF3225365F28946"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           the agreement described in section 462(a)(2) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM
          Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H92BE5E3D60C54B9EA3B3182C1FB0CB49"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           the agreement described in section 462(a)(5) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact;
         
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H31F32E8C85974EA98E5A3EE776F7AA20"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           an agreement concluded pursuant to section 265 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM
          Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0753843E22E84FFFB99BCDFBADD6E1D6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           an agreement concluded pursuant to section 265 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI
          Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H99AB177805F546B88DED486C36A2B561"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (v)
                           an agreement concluded pursuant to section 177 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI
          Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE3A0CA70DC124C658B862FAEF0EE4AF8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (vi)
                           Articles III and IV of the agreement described in section 462(b)(6) of the 2023
          Amended U.S.-FSM Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H43FFCF7A277C4FAAB5551EA3C1C2470E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (vii)
                           Articles III, IV, and X of the agreement described in section 462(b)(6) of the 2023
          Amended U.S.-RMI Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4CB73E1EF67A4B19918A0AA2428CD4C3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (viii)
                           the agreement described in section 462(h) of the U.S.-Palau Compact; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H087E614D38BB40C18BC7F19F16975060"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ix)
                           Articles VI, XV, and XVII of the agreement described in section 462(b)(7) of the 2023
          Amended U.S.-FSM Compact and 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact and section 462(i) of the
          U.S.-Palau Compact.
                        
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H80800FF6E30D41AB91B6E37346EEE0AD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Entry into force of future amendments to subsidiary agreements
                  An agreement between the United States and the Government of the Federated States of
       Micronesia, the Government of the Republic of the Marshall Islands, or the Government of the
       Republic of Palau that would amend, change, or terminate any subsidiary agreement or portion
       of a subsidiary agreement (other than an amendment to, change to, or termination of an
       agreement described in subsection (d)) shall not enter into force until the date that is 90
       days after the date on which the President has transmitted to the President of the Senate and
       the Speaker of the House of Representatives—
                  
                     Effective date. President.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H70CCE76928274FD987DA9364C0BE2B50"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the agreement to amend, change, or terminate the subsidiary agreement;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0512195E84CA45308CE92986C857EA15"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     an explanation of the amendment, change, or termination;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7DFFD61C3C9344BDAF6FCDA4050F3C3D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     a description of the reasons for the amendment, change, or termination; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H02CDE8173E4A427B816C145D20C9910A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     in the case of an agreement that would amend, change, or terminate any agreement
        described in section 462(b)(3) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact or the 2023 Amended
        U.S.-RMI Compact, a statement by the Secretary of Labor that describes—
                     
                        Statement.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H71FAE52D9B3A461CA3AABDE0DE86CF56"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the necessity of the amendment, change, or termination; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0BFD62F4D9C546259E83AAE3BC5D8869"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        any impacts of the amendment, change, or termination. 
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HF8E8200D390D4EF883FD267553C64534"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               205.
               AGREEMENTS WITH FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA
               
                  48 USC 1984.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAE550C7FA0124EE498EC4DA0B01CFD02"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Law enforcement assistance
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H925E0345F6F947E1B54FAB73ABF26CED"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Pursuant to sections 222 and 224 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact, the United
        States shall provide nonreimbursable technical and training assistance, as
          
                           138 STAT. 425
                        
        appropriate, including training and equipment for postal inspection of illicit drugs and
        other contraband, to enable the Government of the Federated States of Micronesia—

        Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C.
         1921d) (as amended by section 209(j)) may be used in accordance with section
        102(a) of the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921a(a)).

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H6BEEB7D499F443569D02FF124BC4BF61"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               206.
               AGREEMENTS WITH AND OTHER PROVISIONS RELATED TO THE REPUBLIC OF THE MARSHALL
      ISLANDS
               
                  48 USC 1985.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HEF2A94C8FD1F43A2A46CF2E1C355F8B2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Law enforcement assistance
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD03CECEF0D2945BF904EF107AC1C2784"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Pursuant to sections 222 and 224 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact, the United
        States shall 
                           138 STAT.
         428
                         provide nonreimbursable technical and training assistance, as
        appropriate, including training and equipment for postal inspection of illicit drugs and
        other contraband, to enable the Government of the Republic of the Marshall Islands—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDDA75FF745424CC0A4F9B6DE290D0AE3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        to develop and adequately enforce laws of the Marshall Islands; and 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA06EE7282C8F4D758EF015C0828EB3F5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        to cooperate with the United States in the enforcement of criminal laws of the United
         States. 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5D040B5D54224F649232055AA8B257A4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Use of appropriated funds
                     Funds appropriated pursuant to subsection (j) of section 105 of the Compact of Free
        Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C.
         1921d) (as amended by section 209(j)) may be used in accordance with section
        103(a) of the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(a)). 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H598378344B314DDF98783AADA83B15EF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Espousal provisions
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF8ACDDDB6E9947A0BD38B9DE780B7C61"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Congress reaffirms that—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H80623192EBE34C15B81743FC9FBB107F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        section 103(g)(1) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1903(g)(1)) and section 103(e)(1) of the
         Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(e)(1)) provided that <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">It is the intention of
          the Congress of the United States that the provisions of section 177 of the Compact of
          Free Association and the Agreement between the Government of the United States and the
          Government of the Marshall Islands for the Implementation of Section 177 of the Compact
          (hereafter in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Section 177 Agreement)
          constitute a full and final settlement of all claims described in Articles X and XI of the
          Section 177 Agreement, and that any such claims be terminated and barred except insofar as
          provided for in the Section 177 Agreement.; and 
                        
                           Time period. President. Contracts.
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBEC70FF72BB84579B0B738028CAE0ABA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        section 103(g)(2) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1903(g)(2)) and section 103(e)(2) of the
         Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(e)(2)) provided that <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">In furtherance of the
          intention of Congress as stated in paragraph (1) of this subsection, the Section 177
          Agreement is hereby ratified and approved. It is the explicit understanding and intent of
          Congress that the jurisdictional limitations set forth in Article XII of such Agreement
          are enacted solely and exclusively to accomplish the objective of Article X of such
          Agreement and only as a clarification of the effect of Article X, and are not to be
          construed or implemented separately from Article X..
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H022B5CC013A64D1F977439FAEC89C9D2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Effect
                     Nothing in the 2023 Agreement to Amend the U.S.-RMI Compact affects the application of
        the provisions of law reaffirmed by paragraph (1).
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCD9F2D59975A406D9A4DDED7F64B9A40"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Certain section 177 agreement provisions
                  Congress reaffirms that—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H453AD7B3A3E6414FBC8A6271A752AA90"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Article IX of the Agreement Between the Government of the United States and the
        Government of the Marshall Islands for the Implementation of Section 177 of the Compact of
        Free Association, done at Majuro June 25, 1983, provided that <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">If loss or damage to
         property and person of the citizens of the Marshall Islands, resulting from the Nuclear
         Testing Program, arises or is discovered after the effective date of this Agreement, and
         such injuries were not and could not 
                              138
           STAT. 429
                            reasonably have been identified as of the effective
         date of this Agreement, and if such injuries render the provisions of this Agreement
         manifestly inadequate, the Government of the Marshall Islands may request that the
         Government of the United States provide for such injuries by submitting such a request to
         the Congress of the United States for its consideration. It is understood that this Article
         does not commit the Congress of the United States to authorize and appropriate
         funds.; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H71589183AC544E66AA4A502BC0F3B2BC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     section 3(a) of Article XIII of the agreement described in paragraph (1) provided that
         <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">The Government of the United States and the Government of the Marshall Islands shall
         consult at the request of either of them on matters relating to the provisions of this
         Agreement..
                     
                        Consultation.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H00D486E165C94E939CC77E403510AC5C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  United States appointees to Joint Economic Management and Financial Accountability
       Committee
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEE3CDC9000214722930905CC2595D671"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The 2 United States appointees (which are composed of the United States chair and 1
        other member from the Government of the United States) to the Joint Economic Management and
        Financial Accountability Committee established under section 214 of the 2003 Amended
        U.S.-RMI Compact (referred to in this subsection as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Committee)
        shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFD08C27F7A2C44C9A3D26DA724F503F2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        be voting members of the Committee; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6474705F646C47CDB5BF3779C28F3FBF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        continue to be officers or employees of the Federal Government.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H708656ADCC3C442F9A0AB07F7D21D835"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Term; appointment
                     The 2 United States members of the Committee described in paragraph (1) shall be
        appointed for a term of 2 years as follows:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBD84F0F66D8A4362970DA9E986624F6D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        1 member shall be appointed by the Secretary of State, in consultation with the
         Secretary of the Treasury.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3FADC2E018A34E06AE201AEE8064D14D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        1 member shall be appointed by the Secretary of the Interior, in consultation with the
         Secretary of the Treasury.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H80069C152BD04C10987A1C6A50A9B11F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Reappointment
                     A United States member of the Committee appointed under paragraph (2) may be
        reappointed for not more than 2 additional 2-year terms. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2146FABDCD37427EAE553E386AFF7BF6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Qualifications
                     At least 1 United States member of the Committee appointed under paragraph (2) shall be
        an individual who—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H39C98E6F8CBA4DA48534DB2389C11514"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        by reason of knowledge, experience, or training, is especially qualified in
         accounting, auditing, budget analysis, compliance, grant administration, program
         management, or international economics; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1AC1AE3BADBF41228F9B6FA4AD12B1C5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        possesses not less than 5 years of full-time experience in accounting, auditing,
         budget analysis, compliance, grant administration, program management, or international
         economics. 
                        
                           Time period.
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1517FA8704A042E1B37F8219B573E01D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Notice
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6EA52C55EADC4A80AEB3ABAD79AE9AC0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        In general
                        
                           Deadline. Statement. Attestation.
                        
                        Not later than 90 days after the date of appointment of a United States member under
         paragraph (2), the Secretary of the Interior shall notify the appropriate committees of
         Congress that an individual has been appointed as a voting member of the Committee under
         that paragraph, including a statement attesting to the qualifications of the member
         described in paragraph (4), subject to subparagraph (B).
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAABA1ED1D64744FBA6898F0CDA5A8B40"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Requirement
                        For purposes of a statement required under subparagraph (A), in the case of a member
         appointed under paragraph (2)(A), the Secretary of the Interior shall compile information
         on the member provided to the Secretary of the Interior by the Secretary of State on
         request of the Secretary of the Interior.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0D0ACEB5E8A347509C9C2C3C67854C19"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Reports to congress
                     Not later than 90 days after the date on which the Committee receives or completes any
        report required under the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact, or any related subsidiary
        agreement, the Secretary of the Interior shall submit the report to the appropriate
        committees of Congress.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCB0B235B6A66460EBA753A68DECE0B3E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     Notice to congress
                     
                        Deadline.
                     
                     Not later than 90 days after the date on which the Government of the Republic of the
        Marshall Islands submits to the Committee a report required under the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI
        Compact, or any related subsidiary agreement, the Secretary of the Interior shall submit to
        the appropriate committees of Congress—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5E731C600F054B489E6331EC406810A1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        if the report is submitted by the applicable deadline, written notice attesting that
         the report is complete and accurate; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H785CE85ACBAC4623B7EBB55904F3F564"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        if the report is not submitted by the applicable deadline, written notice that the
         report has not been timely submitted.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC403DB7CECE24ABB97F5866970907D42"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  United States appointees to Trust Fund Committee
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H74DCC7AF162149B5853CBE74FF1D5870"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The 3 United States voting members (which are composed of the United States chair and 2
        other members from the Government of the United States) to the Trust Fund Committee
        established pursuant to the agreement described in section 462(b)(5) of the 2003 Amended
        U.S.-RMI Compact (referred to in this subsection as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Committee) shall
        continue to be officers or employees of the Federal Government. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1551155DDC004E3CB00E6F2857F365B5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Term; appointment
                     The 3 United States members of the Committee described in paragraph (1) shall be
        appointed for a term not more than 5 years as follows:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA2936700C2004416BB4B9EB6C88D0BDF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        1 member shall be appointed by the Secretary of State.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8D4539786F46465D965DB4B94945B249"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        1 member shall be appointed by the Secretary of the Interior.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2C8C9B3436B24DD5B738A3AA257034D0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        1 member shall be appointed by the Secretary of the Treasury.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H914BE02681894642803AC1AD600B0921"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Reappointment
                     A United States member of the Committee appointed under paragraph (2) may be
        reappointed for not more than 2 additional 2-year terms.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4309DE5B36C340E39DB8B50078A05A74"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Qualifications
                     Not fewer than 2 members of the Committee appointed under paragraph (2) shall be
        individuals who—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H05AB8707D2314675BBAC9000E60E0045"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        by reason of knowledge, experience, or training, are especially qualified in
         accounting, auditing, budget analysis, compliance, financial investment, grant
         administration, program management, or international economics; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H57957677B09C42C0B1ABB00D7E7DB6EE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        possess not less than 5 years of full-time experience in accounting, auditing, budget
         analysis, compliance, financial investment, grant administration, program management, or
         international economics. 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA0578383C6D64C74B675036F05370007"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Notice
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC1C7EA0C4B5E42C18FCE3597FA798843"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        In general
                        
                           Deadline. Statement. Attestation.
                        
                        Not later than 90 days after the date of appointment of a United States Member under
         paragraph (2), the Secretary of the Interior shall notify the appropriate committees of
         Congress that an individual has been appointed as a voting member of the Committee under
         that paragraph, including a statement attesting to the qualifications of the appointee
         described in paragraph (4), subject to subparagraph (B).
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4E6381EE50954892A2772B759AD5610C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Requirement
                        For purposes of a statement required under subparagraph (A)—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEDEDDB5E5CFD4DDE9A7EA010C39E4ED8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           in the case of a member appointed under paragraph (2)(A), the Secretary of the
          Interior shall compile information on the member provided to the Secretary of the Interior
          by the Secretary of State on request of the Secretary of the Interior; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H467696A471034B31A665FFDA7F570C07"

          Interior shall compile information on the member provided to the Secretary of the Interior

                              id="H67074CC264DA4C4398529CA44E84032B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">

        report required under the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact, or any related subsidiary

               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4D207EA6915E4E6BB113B7934F7E8D83"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Four atoll health care program
                  Congress reaffirms that—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5ECA3FC7A2EE4754AD495A5F3776D854"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     section 103(j)(1) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1903(j)(1)) and section 103(h)(1) of the
        Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(h)(1)) provided that services <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">provided by the
         United States Public Health Service or any other United States agency pursuant to section
         1(a) of Article II of the Agreement for the Implementation of Section 177 of the Compact
         (hereafter in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Section 177 Agreement)
         shall be only for services to the people of the Atolls of Bikini, Enewetak, Rongelap, and
         Utrik who were affected by the consequences of the United States nuclear testing program,
         pursuant to the program described in Public Law
          95–134 and Public Law 96–205 and
         their descendants (and any other persons identified as having been so affected if such
         identification occurs in the manner described in such public laws). Nothing in this
         subsection shall be construed as prejudicial to the views or 
                              138 STAT. 432
                            policies of the Government
         of the Marshall Islands as to the persons affected by the consequences of the United States
         nuclear testing program.;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD280637AC570433CB5E8F72CFD2DF260"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     section 103(j)(2) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1903(j)(2)) and section 103(h)(2) of the
        Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(h)(2)) provided that <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">at the end of the first
         year after the effective date of the Compact and at the end of each year thereafter, the
         providing agency or agencies shall return to the Government of the Marshall Islands any
         unexpended funds to be returned to the Fund Manager (as described in Article I of the
         Section 177 Agreement) to be covered into the Fund to be available for future use.;
        and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDD19856B364E4784BF58982AD6124AE1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     section 103(j)(3) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1903(j)(3)) and section 103(h)(3) of the
        Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(h)(3)) provided that <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">the Fund Manager shall
         retain the funds returned by the Government of the Marshall Islands pursuant to paragraph
         (2) of this subsection, shall invest and manage such funds, and at the end of 15 years
         after the effective date of the Compact, shall make from the total amount so retained and
         the proceeds thereof annual disbursements sufficient to continue to make payments for the
         provision of health services as specified in paragraph (1) of this subsection to such
         extent as may be provided in contracts between the Government of the Marshall Islands and
         appropriate United States providers of such health services..
                     
                        Time period.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFFBADFD8C64B460F98685BEAAA0A35F6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Radiological health care program
                  
                     President.
                  
                  Notwithstanding any other provision of law, on the request of the Government of the
       Republic of the Marshall Islands, the President (through an appropriate department or agency
       of the United States) shall continue to provide special medical care and logistical support
       for the remaining members of the population of Rongelap and Utrik who were exposed to
       radiation resulting from the 1954 United States thermonuclear <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Bravo test,
       pursuant to Public Law 95–134 (91 Stat. 1159) and
        Public Law 96–205 (94 Stat. 84).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9C99C99552894B34A68AF4B2FAAF1850"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (h)
                  Agricultural and food programs
                  
                     Grants.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6DF740B26F2A43F2A9DAF2A257F7CB3D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Congress reaffirms that—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H72D0D4EFF8DF461585B56806FA31A547"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        section 103(h)(2) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1903(h)(2)) and section 103(f)(2)(A) of the
         Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(f)(2)(A)) provided that notwithstanding <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">any
          other provision of law, upon the request of the Government of the Marshall Islands, for
          the first fifteen years after the effective date of the Compact, the President (either
          through an appropriate department or agency of the United States or by contract with a
          United States firm or by a grant to the Government of the Republic of the Marshall Islands
          which may further contract only with a United States firm or a Republic of the Marshall
          Islands firm, the owners, officers and majority of the employees of which are citizens of
          the United States or the Republic of the Marshall Islands) shall provide technical and
          other assistance without reimbursement, to continue the planting and agricultural
          maintenance program on Enewetak; without reimbursement, to continue the food programs of
          the Bikini, Rongelap, Utrik, and Enewetak 
                                 138 STAT. 433
                               people described in section 1(d) of Article II of
          the Subsidiary Agreement for the Implementation of Section 177 of the Compact and for
          continued waterborne transportation of agricultural products to Enewetak including
          operations and maintenance of the vessel used for such purposes.; 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3F8A9C5069F64B44BB03F828BF528F16"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        section 103(h)(2) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1903(h)(2)) and section 103(f)(2)(B) of the
         Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(f)(2)(B)) provided that <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">The President shall
          ensure the assistance provided under these programs reflects the changes in the population
          since the inception of such programs.; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4C2F1FA40D814634ACC95EFC9D64A0C2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        section 103(h)(3) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1903(h)(3)) and section 103(f)(3) of the
         Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921b(f)(3)) provided that <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">payments under this
          subsection shall be provided to such extent or in such amounts as are necessary for
          services and other assistance provided pursuant to this subsection. It is the sense of
          Congress that after the periods of time specified in paragraphs (1) and (2) of this
          subsection, consideration will be given to such additional funding for these programs as
          may be necessary..
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0EB5FD5712BE4520A83405FBAD8C10C4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Planting and agricultural maintenance program
                     The Secretary of the Interior may provide grants to the Government of the Republic of
        the Marshall Islands to carry out a planting and agricultural maintenance program on Bikini,
        Enewetak, Rongelap, and Utrik.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0C31DAF19B8E486C90ABC2C9DA1FBDEA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Food programs
                     The Secretary of Agriculture may provide, without reimbursement, food programs to the
        people of the Republic of the Marshall Islands.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H17EAA94F69D0469087DCD02C9CAD23AF"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               207.
               AGREEMENTS WITH AND OTHER PROVISIONS RELATED TO THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU
               
                  48 USC 1986.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF39448EBCA7E4B33A1453F72A784625C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Bilateral economic consultations
                  United States participation in the annual economic consultations referred to in Article
       8 of the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement shall be by officers or employees of the
       Federal Government.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD927ADEAA3CD4C538252A1FA42A296A9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Economic advisory group
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H481597E207C04F279B263E51DC0EE0BB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Qualifications
                     A member of the Economic Advisory Group described in Article 7 of the 2023 U.S.-Palau
        Compact Review Agreement (referred to in this subsection as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Advisory
         Group) who is appointed by the Secretary of the Interior shall be an individual
        who, by reason of knowledge, experience, or training, is especially qualified in private
        sector business development, economic development, or national development. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H729F7C4F92AC454BB7A900F852152572"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Funds
                     With respect to the Advisory Group, the Secretary of the Interior may use available
        funds for— 
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4513D7032F364767B98A83DA74E40473"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the costs of the 2 members of the Advisory Group designated by the United States in
         accordance with Article 7 of the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement; 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H310CA76DB7124F0BB1A5D07868BAF555"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        50 percent of the costs of the 5th member of the Advisory Group designated by the
         Secretary of the Interior in accordance with the Article described in subparagraph (A);
         and
                        
                           138 STAT. 434
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCC28B5AEAE55444B80DEDA352B9E64DF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the costs of—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H92639FBFAB834675A34E81B1EE4CC596"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           technical and administrative assistance for the Advisory Group; and 
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5F604F0C510C4E1EBE3B13CBE595F22E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           other support necessary for the Advisory Group to accomplish the purpose of the
          Advisory Group.
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1835AF32D34F4278872586A655E35784"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Reports to congress
                     Not later than 90 days after the date on which the Advisory Group receives or completes
        any report required under the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement, or any related
        subsidiary agreement, the Secretary of the Interior shall submit the report to the
        appropriate committees of Congress.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA71C291ABE834B2E884BF36017FD9605"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">

                  Reports to Congress
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCC8604D595674D37B8E85749DA4A78CB"

                     Not later than 90 days after the date on which the Government of the Republic of Palau

         the report is complete and accurate; or
