         report has not been timely submitted. 
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HDFDD0AF75EC94B1DAE1D10E4530DC535"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               208.
               OVERSIGHT PROVISIONS
               
                  48 USC 1987.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9B8C5800B7C54512901C2B4100AC8F2A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Authorities and duties of the Comptroller General of the United States
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H38D6E0118A444CED9AD6B5DB7A474D14"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Comptroller General of the United States (including any duly authorized
        representative of the Comptroller General of the United States) shall have the authorities
        necessary to carry out the responsibilities of the Comptroller General of the United States
        under—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H69C97FC7A02A4E3EB502F9AD4849C4F6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact and related subsidiary agreements, including the
         authorities and privileges described in section 102(b) of the Compact of Free Association
         Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C.
          1921a(b));
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H556D58C6959A4234ACC4E0973A8DE92C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact and related subsidiary agreements, including the
         authorities and privileges described in section 103(k) of the Compact of Free Association
         Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C.
          1921b(k)); and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8C7C8A7B8F0D451580FDEA394AB80C8E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement, related subsidiary agreements, and the
         authorities described in appendix D of the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Agreement between the Government of the
          United States of America and the Government of the Republic of Palau Following the Compact
          of Free Association Section 432 Review signed by the United States and the
         Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010.
                        
                           138 STAT. 435
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC5131E6AA2444B4EBD0FF36FBA5C681A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Reports
                     
                        Time period.
                     
                     Not later than 18 months after the date of the enactment of this Act, and every 4 years
        thereafter, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to the appropriate
        committees of Congress a report with respect to the Freely Associated States, including
        addressing—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8AEF6224917C41ECA6A7A8D60AD16787"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the topics described in subparagraphs (A) through (E) of section 104(h)(1) of the
         Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921c(h)(1)), except that for purposes of a report
         submitted under this paragraph, the report shall address those topics with respect to each
         of the Freely Associated States; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H222FA52C24A84F60A655364DCD52FEEE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the effectiveness of administrative oversight by the United States of the Freely
         Associated States. 
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDBCE5DC1DDA146C9BACA36DC52BE89C5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Secretary of the Interior oversight authority
                  The Secretary of the Interior shall have the authority necessary to fulfill the
       responsibilities for monitoring and managing the funds appropriated to the Compact of Free
       Association account of the Department of the Interior by section 211(a) to carry out—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCD43D715DB3B4ECDBD0E0B33AAAD3C08"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9855FC9822514072A704D26E5480FFB8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3E03205819384E028798EBE14A546770"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2BE4A433A83441F7B2A2A7A5EF3B74AA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     subsidiary agreements.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H893CE15F6C1A415A8A0E25F5EBB83DEE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Postmaster General oversight authority
                  The Postmaster General shall have the authority necessary to fulfill the
       responsibilities for monitoring and managing the funds appropriated to the United States
       Postal Service under paragraph (1) of section 211(b) and deposited in the Postal Service Fund
       under paragraph (2)(A) of that section to carry out—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H57C8A8B08FB340F5AAF99B6B5F789AB5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     section 221(a)(2) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3EC731336FB344B391B7F5651D6E2864"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     section 221(a)(2) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA8E9AAEC04A64D95886978456A96A37A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     section 221(a)(2) of the U.S.-Palau Compact; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAFABFD6B952A4DC5984718557C60A4CC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Article 6(a) of the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H76CDDA273F8043468DC0183414153F82"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Interagency Group on Freely Associated States
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2D490B4D6D3A4289AFCE6B6CA8CF7E11"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Establishment
                     
                        President.
                     
                     The President, in consultation with the Secretary of State, the Secretary of the
        Interior, and the Secretary of Defense, shall establish an Interagency Group on Freely
        Associated States (referred to in this subsection as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Interagency
        Group).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFD36A3A5E19E4AA2857FCA1FAC5CDE5F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Purpose
                     The purposes of the Interagency Group are—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBB05A65E313A4952A7406D751A49947D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        to coordinate development and implementation of executive branch policies, programs,
         services, and other activities in or relating to the Freely Associated States; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD93C3DFCADA14F218C977E4A42E797C7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        to provide policy guidance, recommendations, and oversight to Federal agencies,
         departments, and instrumentalities with respect to the implementation of—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H166A697E62E847B8BB3EDC56284CD745"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB88C2F726CED4DC3BAB4EFBC9AD34A1E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H29ABB38002BC44C6A83929E979E5B012"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement.
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H698C4579BE304745B1EC9C72B367727A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Membership
                     The Interagency Group shall consist of—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDE8F65E3765340A2983068B1CEC6EA6B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the Secretary of State, who shall serve as co-chair of the Interagency Group;
                        
                           138 STAT. 436
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCBF7ACC990B04675AAC9D040C939D5BE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the Secretary of the Interior, who shall serve as co-chair of the Interagency
         Group;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H363E719DCC36449D9E91220ED9502045"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the Secretary of Defense;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD34AED5D2BD14182905E4E956D37F936"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        the Secretary of the Treasury; 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF0AB0C446A46413384612D1F1C7105E8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        the heads of relevant Federal agencies, departments, and instrumentalities carrying
         out obligations under—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2352F54E11DC47AA9DD4058F06C14067"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           sections 131 and 132 of the 2003 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact and subsections (a) and (b)
          of section 221 and section 261 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2BE346C1B58442C19CBD85DF93918523"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           sections 131 and 132 of the 2003 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact and subsections (a) and (b)
          of section 221 and section 261 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE94F6A5E6C1C4D44BE8423A8F79873BA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           sections 131 and 132 and subsections (a) and (b) of section 221 of the U.S.-Palau
          Compact;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2C8E8D036BAA4A31B04B6902B7BA26F6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           Article 6 of the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7A0FA92116704161992BBDDBED7B2792"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (v)
                           any applicable subsidiary agreement; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H022CE3F06AD44E6799807A7D5BE865F5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (vi)
                           section 209; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF99232910F9443D08CA9A96AA94F34EA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        the head of any other Federal agency, department, or instrumentality that the
         Secretary of State or the Secretary of the Interior may designate.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3415386BEFB14680B6F147C1059CEB44"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Duties of secretary of state and secretary of the interior
                     The Secretary of State (or a senior official designee of the Secretary of State) and
        the Secretary of the Interior (or a senior official designee of the Secretary of the
        Interior) shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H11500E08AFEC495288F8FA88E8960038"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        co-lead and preside at a meeting of the Interagency Group not less frequently than
         annually;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB7393A9B8AEC4A4E9223B79478AFC14D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        determine, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense, the agenda for meetings of
         the Interagency Group; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4D28BE3A7D134B2381D7CFB8D9AF74CF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        facilitate and coordinate the work of the Interagency Group.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE4893E07705746619D5E9DC2DA8B36A8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Duties of the Interagency Group
                     The Interagency Group shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H096CEF395E9D47938F74DEA9306F3342"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        provide advice on the establishment or implementation of policies relating to the
         Freely Associated States to the President, acting through the Office of Intergovernmental
         Affairs, in the form of a written report not less frequently than annually;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0A03F7AC28D94E35BAC00A07787639A7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        obtain information and advice relating to the Freely Associated States from the
         Presidents, other elected officials, and members of civil society of the Freely Associated
         States, including through the members of the Interagency Group (including senior official
         designees of the members) meeting not less frequently than annually with any Presidents of
         the Freely Associated States who elect to participate;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H35C0BE8505D444E6868B795ED468F643"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        at the request of the head of any Federal agency (or a senior official designee of the
         head of a Federal agency) who is a member of the Interagency Group, promptly review and
         provide advice on a policy or policy implementation action affecting 1 or more of the
         Freely 
                              138 STAT. 437
                           
         Associated States proposed by the Federal agency, department, or instrumentality;
         and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDE041B364BC248EA9EAE9EB0203EE5D6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        facilitate coordination of relevant policies, programs, initiatives, and activities
         involving 1 or more of the Freely Associated States, including ensuring coherence and
         avoiding duplication between programs, initiatives, and activities conducted pursuant to a
         Compact with a Freely Associated State and non-Compact programs, initiatives, and
         activities.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H64F14D57D5414F90BA7045665066C2B0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Reports
                     
                        President.
                     
                     Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act and each year
        thereafter in which a Compact of Free Association with a Freely Associated State is in
        effect, the President shall submit to the majority leader and minority leader of the Senate,
        the Speaker and minority leader of the House of Representatives, and the appropriate
        committees of Congress a report that describes the activities and recommendations of the
        Interagency Group during the applicable year.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFD703D0EE6D246CEA7E97BE07323B747"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Federal agency coordination
                  The head of any Federal agency providing programs and services to the Federated States
       of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, or the Republic of Palau shall
       coordinate with the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of State regarding the
       provision of the programs and services.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBDBE5DCBD6024694B4C71CA531748F7B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Foreign loans or debt
                  Congress reaffirms that—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDE4FF6FB3E9546B09E570C0FDD35E857"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the foreign loans or debt of the Government of the Federated States of Micronesia, the
        Government of the Republic of the Marshall Islands, or the Government of the Republic of
        Palau shall not constitute an obligation of the United States; and 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA87B918C8CE845A0941933379AEF164F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the full faith and credit of the United States Government shall not be pledged for the
        payment and performance of any foreign loan or debt referred to in paragraph (1) without
        specific further authorization.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0141C0F8F2B341908BA4250DE7176E66"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Compact compilation
                  
                     Reports.
                  
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the
       Interior shall submit a report to the appropriate committees of Congress that includes a
       compilation of the Compact of Free Association with the Federated State of Micronesia, the
       Compact of Free Association with the Republic of Palau, and the Compact of Free Association
       with Republic of the Marshall Islands.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H630DE50ECA8A4A02AC610A677E38DDB6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (h)
                  Publication; Revision by Office of the Law Revision Counsel
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H63AD76E545DD4D1B92FF93E740B7FE47"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Publication
                     In publishing this title in slip form and in the United States Statutes at Large
        pursuant to section 112 of title 1, United States Code, the Archivist of the United States
        shall include after the date of approval at the end an appendix setting forth the text
        of—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAF5A401ED05E45E1BB9A49FF3D84615B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the 2023 Agreement to Amend the U.S.-FSM Compact; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H348C8584411A4F72B3538677BA6AA1DC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the 2023 Agreement to Amend the U.S.-RMI Compact.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H420E5F3247C1419D82E253F05B3C5A8F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Revision by office of the law revision counsel
                     The Office of the Law Revision Counsel is directed to revise—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA3A93CFB8B3E43B9A76B27740DE630BB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the 2003 Amended U.S.- 
                              138 STAT.
           438
                            FSM Compact set forth in the note following section 1921 of
         title 48, United States Code, to reflect the amendments to the 2003 Amended U.S.-FSM
         Compact made by the 2023 Agreement to Amend the U.S.-FSM Compact; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDEB6B84CC8864ED3B1E234EE4C9BC517"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the 2003 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact set forth in the note following section 1921 of
         title 48, United States Code, to reflect the amendments to the 2003 Amended U.S.-RMI
         Compact made by the 2023 Agreement to Amend the U.S.-RMI Compact.
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H7575CBF3B2244CB582A78E32EDDF9C3F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               209.
               UNITED STATES POLICY REGARDING THE FREELY ASSOCIATED STATES
               
                  48 USC 1988.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H671280CD39C34BA5AA1586A1E17AADD9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Authorization for veterans’ services
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H938D4495BF14455AA7AB9DA5DD426501"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Definition of Freely Associated States
                     In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Freely Associated States means—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD0FEF366F8984472966FE79792123EAB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the Federated States of Micronesia, during such time as it is a party to the Compact
         of Free Association set forth in section 201 of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985
          (Public Law 99–239; 48 U.S.C. 1901 note);
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBA5222A2230C4CA2A2249612F019BABA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the Republic of the Marshall Islands, during such time as it is a party to the Compact
         of Free Association set forth in section 201 of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985
          (Public Law 99–239; 48 U.S.C. 1901 note); and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1CB3663A4C2245B284BA7C50D3DC4716"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the Republic of Palau, during such time as it is a party to the Compact of Free
         Association between the United 
                              138 STAT.
           440
                            States and the Government of Palau set forth in section 201
         of Joint Resolution entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Joint Resolution to approve the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Compact of Free
           Association between the United States and the Government of Palau, and for other
          purposes (Public Law 99–658; 48 U.S.C. 1931 note).
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9744BBCD70E9462B8E9BBC305A91DAB4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Hospital care, medical services, and nursing home care abroad
                     Section 1724 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCD08585866CC44D6A0B90CE4C50CE1B8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in subsection (a), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">subsections (b) and (c) and inserting
          <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">subsections (b), (c), and (f); and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H50F3D946B6D14B88B3609779586B00DF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by adding at the end the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H35F7EE0471E5454B88FBB79BDC2F43E6"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H28EC500E00F64029BABB20D00C4E733A"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (f)
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H78894B0534424AA3A648D212ED001E6B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H1526774F8E1B425980E223BFD99726C8"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    The Secretary may furnish hospital care and medical services in the Freely
             Associated States, subject to agreements the Secretary shall enter into with the
             governments of the Freely Associated States as described in section 209(a)(4)(A) of the
             Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2024, and subject to subparagraph (B), to
             a veteran who is otherwise eligible to receive hospital care and medical
             services.
                                    
                                       Contracts.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HC60A0917523A447680C593DFE39E780A"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    The agreements described in subparagraph (A) shall incorporate, to the extent
             practicable, the applicable laws of the Freely Associated States and define the care
             and services that can be legally provided by the Secretary in the Freely Associated
             States.
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC558EEDC526C4BDC9E2869184023EF5E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 In furnishing hospital care and medical services under paragraph (1), the Secretary
            may furnish hospital care and medical services through—
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HA78375D7E2B24509B3C5AB4A6726CA0D"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    contracts or other agreements;
                                    
                                       Contracts.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H7460B81E0BDE4E21908874013D36E2DD"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    reimbursement; or
                                    
                                       Reimbursement.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HF3CD767300A64CAB9D1BAF0DAF0E6A1C"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (C)
                                    the direct provision of care by health care personnel of the Department.
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H63763F1488224F91BB07A10B4BAB2885"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (3)
                                 In furnishing hospital care and medical services under paragraph (1), the Secretary
            may furnish hospital care and medical services for any condition regardless of whether
            the condition is connected to the service of the veteran in the Armed Forces.
                                 
                                    138 STAT. 439
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6D66A471562C4351B7F106C81E938BE2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (4)
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HDDC1FCA9CF9E4A7FA56520097FB9E04B"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    A veteran who has received hospital care or medical services in a country pursuant
             to this subsection shall remain eligible, to the extent determined advisable and
             practicable by the Secretary, for hospital care or medical services in that country
             regardless of whether the country continues to qualify as a Freely Associated State for
             purposes of this subsection.
                                    
                                       Determinations.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H818AA44244B94E70B4C626C42C949C05"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    If the Secretary determines it is no longer advisable or practicable to allow
             veterans described in subparagraph (A) to remain eligible for hospital care or medical
             services pursuant to such subparagraph, the Secretary shall—
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE071984CD4FE47D48505C21A1AE6EA57"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (i)
                                       provide direct notice of that determination to such veterans; and
                                       
                                          Notice.
                                       
                                    
                                    <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HD9BCD2D9A1CF451DB04BB84559ABEA13"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (ii)
                                       publish that determination and the reasons for that determination in the Federal
              Register.
                                       
                                          Federal Register, publication.
                                       
                                    
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H92DC3987DEAE45E79A6D675B829073EA"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (5)
                                 In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">Freely Associated States means—
                                 
                                    Definitions.
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H53A16DD62DD243FE986F3DFD76AF7629"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    the Federated States of Micronesia, during such time as it is a party to the
             Compact of Free Association set forth in section 201 of the Compact of Free Association
             Act of 1985 (Public Law 99–239; 48 U.S.C. 1901 note);
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H66AFECB9546042F19870830587C80358"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    the Republic of the Marshall Islands, during such time as it is a party to the
             Compact of Free Association set forth in section 201 of the Compact of Free Association
             Act of 1985 (Public Law 99–239; 48 U.S.C. 1901 note); and
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="HE80CB497A92246298381DE37BEAD3BF1"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (C)
                                    the Republic of Palau, during such time as it is a party to the Compact of Free
             Association between the United States and the Government of Palau set forth in section
             201 of Joint Resolution entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                               quote-display-start="auto"
                                               quote-type="text">Joint Resolution to approve the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                                  quote-display-start="auto"
                                                  quote-type="text">Compact
               of Free Association between the United States and the Government of Palau,
              and for other purposes (Public Law
              99–658; 48 U.S.C. 1931
             note).
                                 
                              
                           
                           .
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB82F8356C6724D339F74BA460B06F4A5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Beneficiary travel
                     Section 111 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the
        following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H9D7BAFE465B944B7AD4132098875625F"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H9ADD8FE93BE645BBAEDF21607BE5A62D"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (h)
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3D0406C29C224369BF5CFBDA5E100431"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary may make payments to or
           for any person traveling in, to, or from the Freely Associated States for receipt of care
           or services authorized to be legally provided by the Secretary in the Freely Associated
           States under section 1724(f)(1) of this title.
                              
                                 Payments.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H75758D3F15024DA3A4785605AD201759"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              A person who has received payment for travel in a country pursuant to this
           subsection shall remain eligible for payment for such travel in that country regardless
           of whether the country continues to qualify as a Freely Associated State for purposes of
           this subsection.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB674516171194100AC9803AFB35D15EB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              The Secretary shall prescribe regulations to carry out this subsection.
                              
                                 Regulations.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5C1B0AF4EBE74CB8814DD1B5197EE488"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">Freely Associated States means—
                              
                                 Definitions.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA61969B7149B4DD784B0D5C9F1A8EF24"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 the Federated States of Micronesia, during such time as it is a party to the
            Compact of Free Association set forth in section 201 of the Compact of Free Association
            Act of 1985 (Public Law 99–239; 48 U.S.C. 1901 note);
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HCC66423CFCF942B4A2D899A49323D8F6"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 the Republic of the Marshall Islands, during such time as it is a party to the
            Compact of Free Association set forth in section 201 of the Compact of Free Association
            Act of 1985 (Public Law 99–239; 48 U.S.C. 1901 note); and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H821C59F100F740DFB6BFC9D971531172"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">

                                 the Republic of Palau, during such time as it is a party to the Compact of Free
            Association between the United States and the Government of Palau set forth in section
            201 of Joint Resolution entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">Joint Resolution to approve the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                               quote-display-start="auto"
                                               quote-type="text">Compact
              of Free Association between the United States and the Government of Palau, and
             for other purposes (Public Law
             99–658; 48 U.S.C. 1931
            note).

                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H64946F0FDEB346048F55E9601DABFEA2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Legal issues
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H76689A7207024558958A72F84A929E0A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        Agreements to furnish care and services
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD23D5D1479B146A793A42C690323BAE8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           In general
                           Before delivering hospital care or medical services under subsection (f) of section
          1724 of title 38, United States Code, as added by paragraph (2)(B), the Secretary of
          Veterans Affairs, in consultation with the Secretary of State, shall enter into agreements
          with the governments of the Freely Associated States to—
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3240C9BA2A3C498FBC9B7D1D42BDC350"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              facilitate the furnishing of health services, including telehealth, under the laws
           administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to veterans in the Freely Associated
           States, such as by addressing—
                              <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H0EAA620B9E2444118655F1E420BBB3BC"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (aa)
                                 licensure, certification, registration, and tort issues relating to health care
            personnel; 
                              
                              <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HE5289F1242484E7EB06E5EAA918415D0"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (bb)
                                 the scope of health services the Secretary may furnish, as well as the means for
            furnishing such services; and
                              
                              <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H33130133661C46B8AB0B80256DC2034D"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (cc)
                                 matters relating to delivery of pharmaceutical products and medical surgical
            products, including delivery of such products through the Consolidated Mail Outpatient
            Pharmacy of the Department of Veterans Affairs, to the Freely Associated States;
                              
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H89EBC670A0AD4BB1A38DA986104F41D0"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              clarify the authority of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to pay for tort claims as
           set forth under subparagraph (C); and
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H13FA39002AD34F5E9B2C5074F2E07136"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (III)
                              clarify authority and responsibility on any other matters determined relevant by the
           Secretary of Veterans Affairs or the governments of the Freely Associated States.
                           
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H484E48DE1F3A432684081875EDAB48DF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           Scope of agreements
                           The agreements described in clause (i) shall incorporate, to the extent practicable,
          the applicable laws of the Freely Associated States and define the care and services that
          can be legally provided by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs in the Freely Associated
          States.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H01DA6B8AE1EC428FA287737AD6DBBF57"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           Report to Congress
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H481F272410E7480CB580DA9DC5D5EC30"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              In general
                              Not later than 90 days after entering into an agreement described in clause (i), the
           Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall submit the agreement to the appropriate committees of
           Congress.
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF04A3295FC414659A52D7C3F16D87084"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              Appropriate committees of Congress defined
                              In this clause, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">appropriate committees of Congress
           means—
                              <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HA8F5E2CFD6134446AD9E1C0811441492"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (aa)
                                 the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, the Committee on Foreign Relations,
            and the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate; and
                                 
                                    138 STAT. 441
                                 
                              
                              <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H83F5309A63124E4999DCD42C89C8D79F"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (bb)
                                 the Committee on Natural Resources, the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and the
            Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives.
                              
                           
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE9D50D31AA834483A9EF9234D7614AE3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Licensure of health care professionals providing treatment via telemedicine in the
         freely associated states
                        Section 1730C(a) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">any
          State and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">any State or any of the Freely Associated States (as
          defined in section 1724(f) of this title).
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB4E2AD7332B947D0A4546939A9B8B434"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Payment of claims
                        The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may pay tort claims, in the manner authorized in the
         first paragraph of section 2672 of title 28, United States Code, when such claims arise in
         the Freely Associated States in connection with furnishing hospital care or medical
         services or providing medical consultation or medical advice to a veteran under the laws
         administered by the Secretary, including through a remote or telehealth program.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5AF713AB2CDF4F8B9F676DAA79EED96F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Outreach and assessment of options
                     
                        Time period.
                     
                     During the 1-year period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary
        of Veterans Affairs shall, subject to the availability of appropriations—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF6449C763C1646BCB03A9B89B27575EC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        conduct robust outreach to, and engage with, each government of the Freely Associated
         States;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H769F9F68505D404CA16DADBBC9D54CDD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        assess options for the delivery of care through the use of authorities provided
         pursuant to the amendments made by this subsection; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H850FCFA351FB42F893C9E273729C5215"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        increase staffing as necessary to conduct outreach under subparagraph (A).
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDFD8F09CAA684873B16D8F7636B4B20F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Authorization of education programs
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H10A59A6846824A2B9FADE75D653D3B93"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Eligibility
                     
                        Grants.
                     
                     For fiscal year 2024 and each fiscal year thereafter, the Government of the United
        States shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB0B0442FDB564EF583AEFB8CE2C435EA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        continue to make available to the Federated States of Micronesia, the Republic of the
         Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau, grants for services to individuals eligible
         for such services under part B of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (20 U.S.C. 1411 et seq.) to the extent that
         those services continue to be available to individuals in the United States;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4468E0DFE41A4A40A64567964D432911"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        continue to make available to the Federated States of Micronesia and the Republic of
         the Marshall Islands and make available to the Republic of Palau, competitive grants under
         the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6301 et seq.), the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical
         Education Act of 2006 (20 U.S.C. 2301 et
          seq.), and part D of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (20 U.S.C. 1450 et seq.), to the extent that
         those grants continue to be available to State and local governments in the United
         States;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H57CE0A4986A5413C82C96485F1B15A01"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        continue to make grants available to the Republic of Palau under part A of title I of
         the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6311 et seq.), the Adult Education and Family Literacy Act
          (29 U.S.C. 3271 et seq.), and the
         Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 (20 U.S.C. 2301 et seq
                           
                              138 STAT. 442
                           
         .);
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H549B634DDCAE45979B27F6820B2D22F8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        continue to make available to eligible institutions of higher education in the
         Republic of Palau and make available to eligible institutions of higher education in the
         Federated States of Micronesia and the Republic of the Marshall Islands and to students
         enrolled in those institutions of higher education, and to students who are citizens of the
         Federated States of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of
         Palau and enrolled in institutions of higher education in the United States and territories
         of the United States, grants under—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4549E0F882A7445ABE5BF9DC839FBE1F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           subpart 1 of part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070a et seq.);
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H688EF309ED794ED38DC0EB9841B27674"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           subpart 3 of part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070b et seq.); and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H743367666BD14785B4CD23CF711BB298"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           part C of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087–51 et seq.);
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H43C19FA4A27F4D72A0F64B14D22BE712"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        require, as a condition of eligibility for a public institution of higher education in
         any State (as defined in section 103 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1003)) that is not a Freely
         Associated State to participate in or receive funds under any program under title IV of
         such Act (20 U.S.C. 1070 et seq.),
         that the institution charge students who are citizens of the Federated States of
         Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, or the Republic of Palau tuition for
         attendance at a rate that is not greater than the rate charged for residents of the State
         in which such public institution of higher education is located; and
                        
                           Requirement.
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H999A3E4292A3422EA34331F169311F34"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        continue to make available, to eligible institutions of higher education, secondary
         schools, and nonprofit organizations in the Federated States of Micronesia, the Republic of
         the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau, competitive grants under the Higher
         Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001 et
          seq.).
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H67F8F75A8AB24C7C8641FD0660EA552F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Other formula grants
                     Except as provided in paragraph (1), the Secretary of Education shall not make a grant
        under any formula grant program administered by the Department of Education to the Federated
        States of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, or the Republic of Palau.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H60A506F7E0DE417589DFA6DB0C11E20A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Grants to the Freely Associated States under part B of the Individuals with
        Disabilities Education Act
                     Section 611(b)(1) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (20 U.S.C. 1411(b)(1)) is amended by striking
        subparagraph (A) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HE392D203EC174F72945A5C6B720DFD0F"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9412392BE8F7445CB7761EDC837A2E3D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           Funds reserved
                           From the amount appropriated for any fiscal year under subsection (i), the Secretary
          shall reserve not more than 1 percent, which shall be used as follows:
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7974AF2ADF6B4E00AAE3F011D13D0307"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              To provide assistance to the outlying areas in accordance with their respective
           populations of individuals aged 3 through 21.
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H92BAA8E1FA474B849DACBCF3F4831122"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4EFE1BC9E6CE490692FEA1F182AB7318"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 To provide each freely associated State a grant so that no freely associated State
            receives a lesser share of the total funds reserved for the freely associated State than
            the freely associated State received of those funds for fiscal year 2023.
                                 
                                    138 STAT. 443
                                 
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5C3E5F26D346428683BAF76C93A60934"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 Each freely associated State shall establish its eligibility under this
            subparagraph consistent with the requirements for a State under section 612.
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0A4427FEA00045A1935F0480190208A9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (III)
                                 The funds provided to each freely associated State under this part may be used to
            provide, to each infant or toddler with a disability (as defined in section 632), either
            a free appropriate public education, consistent with section 612, or early intervention
            services consistent with part C, notwithstanding the application and eligibility
            requirements of sections 634(2), 635, and 637.
                              
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC2F86F84A1364354ABBE5BCB6245E7A4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Technical amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
                     The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6301 et seq.) is amended— 
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBD2D0E473F2E446EB01900AA7BC8A873"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        by striking subparagraph (A) of section 1121(b)(1) (20 U.S.C. 6331(b)(1)) and inserting the following: 
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H94B90EF587EC43748D72BA560CB056C2"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD77CA34EAD334851B4E9E5FDC0602521"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              first reserve $1,000,000 for the Republic of Palau, subject to such terms and
           conditions as the Secretary may establish, except that Public Law 95–134, permitting the consolidation of grants, shall not apply;
           and
                           
                           ; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H062991DFF81C4AFEB62DCCA7976F0FCD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        in section 8101 (20 U.S.C.
         7801), by amending paragraph (36) to read as follows:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="HBF9D8751FF0F4A7184FD6C43DD488B07"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H1F4684D1D812450F8815DED4D4521943"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (36)
                              Outlying area
                              
                                 Definition.
                              
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">outlying area—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H49EB57F010B842158A8E21F72A9EF24B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 means American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and
            the United States Virgin Islands; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3F8F32F34B864A8D810443380EEA75CB"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 for the purpose of any discretionary grant program under this Act, includes the
            Republic of the Marshall Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Republic
            of Palau, to the extent that any such grant program continues to be available to State
            and local governments in the United States.
                              
                           
                           .
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3EDB25F0A5544C2F97CE90B65C09BFB2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Technical amendment to the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of
        2003
                     Section 105(f)(1)(B) of the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003
         (48 U.S.C. 1921d(f)(1)(B)) is
        amended by striking clause (ix).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7B3E0CA363514BF293E4981809DC18EE"
