                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H392ADF5D577B4EFB84AAC33ADA8D9763"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     Coordination required
                     The Secretary of the Interior, in coordination with the Secretary of Education and the
        Secretary of Health and Human Services, as applicable, shall, to the maximum extent
        practicable, coordinate with the 3 United States appointees to the Joint Economic Management
        Committee described in section 205(b)(1) and the 2 United States appointees to the Joint
        Economic Management and Financial Accountability Committee described in section 206(d)(1) to
        avoid duplication of economic assistance for education provided under section 261(a)(1) of
        the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact or section 261(a)(1) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact
        of activities or services provided under—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H363FC621E0DB43AA94A7CB9040442F30"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the Head Start Act (42 U.S.C. 9831 et
          seq.);
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3A303A8BB867427F8F72D4EDC8C4CE8E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        subpart 3 of part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070b et seq.); or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7762E5D2319C4EDEA633BA9A8A9AF688"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        part C of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087–51 et seq.).
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H76705BD351C040DCA2F6D27905AA9E1D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Authorization of Department of Defense programs
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9BEA94C2C9E248DCBB170F5A0084CF73"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Department of Defense medical facilities
                     
                        Reimbursement.
                     
                     The Secretary of Defense shall make available, on a space available and reimbursable
        basis, the medical facilities of the Department of Defense for use by citizens of the
        Federated States of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of
        Palau, who are properly referred to the facilities by government authorities responsible for
        provision of medical services in the Federated States of Micronesia, the Republic of the
        Marshall Islands, the Republic of Palau, and the affected jurisdictions (as defined in
        section 104(e)(2) of the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921c(e)(2))).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFD909F9FA19D47EB824707DE06B52F5C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Participation by secondary schools in the Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery
        Student Testing Program
                     It is the sense of Congress that the Department of Defense may extend the Armed
        Services Vocational Aptitude Battery (ASVAB) Student Testing Program and the ASVAB Career
        Exploration Program to selected secondary schools in the Federated States of Micronesia, the
        Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau to the extent such programs are
        available to Department of Defense dependent secondary schools established under section
        2164 of title 10, United States Code, and located outside the United States. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H131610EDBDC74DCE87AB2030D4D125FF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Judicial training
                  
                     Time periods.
                  
                  In addition to amounts provided under section 261(a)(4) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM
       Compact and the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact and under subsections (a) and (b) of Article 1
       of the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement, for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2043,
       the Secretary of the Interior shall use the amounts made available to the Secretary of the
       Interior under section 211(c) to train judges and officials of the judiciary in the Federated
       States of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau, in
       cooperation with the Pacific Islands Committee of the judicial council of the ninth judicial
       circuit of the United States.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE06F9209DF354FBE99C09BD922A74877"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Eligibility for the Republic of Palau
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H09BD1F1962744BE68EE3613D35578E36"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     National Health Service Corps
                     The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall make the services of the National
        Health Service Corps available to the residents of 
                           138 STAT. 445
                         the Federated States of Micronesia, the
        Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau to the same extent, and for the
        same duration, as services are authorized to be provided to persons residing in any other
        areas within or outside the United States. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0DFFA2E646934A1F91FC122A7F025AE6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Additional programs and services
                     The Republic of Palau shall be eligible for the programs and services made available to
        the Federated States of Micronesia and the Republic of the Marshall Islands under section
        108(a) of the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921g(a)).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB2C145AC04D942EFAD471514E5444F2D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)

        and Services Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, the programs and
        services of the following agencies shall be made available to the Republic of Palau:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCCEA2BB597B44F209653E61F3BCF92FC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">

                        The Legal Services Corporation.

                        The Public Health Service.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H68EB24EB9AF04227B409C3D7FDC708F5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        The Rural Housing Service.

         Free Association with the Freely Associated States.

                  Technical assistance
                  Section 105 of the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921d) is amended by striking
       subsection (j) and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H7B9A65F927E7456392DC1578334FBCEA"

                        (j)
                        Technical assistance
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H76CC9613DC6540E0BFEBE5A47F026310"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           Technical assistance may be provided pursuant to section 224 of the 2023 Amended
          U.S.-FSM Compact, section 224 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact, or section 222 of the
          U.S.-Palau Compact (as those terms are defined in section 203 of the Compact of Free
          Association Amendments Act of 2024) by Federal agencies and institutions of the Government
          of the United States to the extent the assistance shall be provided to States,
          territories, or units of local government.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H93659897A65E41D281A1260D8E894E9F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">

                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                              (A)
                              In general
                              Any technical assistance authorized under paragraph (1) that is provided by the
           Forest Service, the Natural Resources Conservation Service, the United States Fish and
           Wildlife Service, the National Marine Fisheries Service, the United States Coast Guard,
           the Advisory Council on Historic Preservation, the Department of the Interior, or any
           other Federal agency providing assistance under division A of subtitle III of title 54,
           United States Code, may be provided on a nonreimbursable basis.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                          qb-display-quote="yes">

                              Grants
                              
                                 Applicability.
                              
                              During the period in which the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact (as so defined) and the
           2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact (as so defined) are in force, the grant programs under
           division A of subtitle III of title 54, United States Code, shall continue to apply to
           the Federated States of Micronesia and the Republic of the Marshall Islands in the same
           manner and to the same extent as those programs applied prior to the approval of the
           U.S.-FSM Compact and U.S.-RMI Compact.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H71B2B709FCBE4BCEBA2D3F23D21B2D37"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">

          (l), and (m), section 102(a), and subsections (a), (b), (f), (g), (h), and (j) of section
          103 shall be in addition to, and not charged against, any amounts to be paid to the
          Federated States of Micronesia or the Republic of the Marshall Islands pursuant to—

                              any related subsidiary agreement.
                           
                        
                     
                     .

                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (k)
                  Continuing trust territory authorization
                  The authorization provided by the Act of June 30, 1954 (68 Stat. 330,
         
                        138 STAT. 448
                      chapter
       423), shall remain available after the effective date of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact
       and the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact with respect to the Federated States of Micronesia and
       the Republic of the Marshall Islands for transition purposes, including—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0BD18D353A76468B8973612AA9BE565F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     completion of projects and fulfillment of commitments or obligations;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6F1140ECB7514BA7A421132BBC7BBBBB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     termination of the Trust Territory Government and termination of the High Court;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3AF5CF313D4942B5AFC9A4806F326FB9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     health and education as a result of exceptional circumstances;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3BA87B37677647CBB032A9E5389E42F1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     ex gratia contributions for the populations of Bikini, Enewetak, Rongelap, and Utrik;
        and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6EB866A542D642CEBDB8766EC41E5608"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     technical assistance and training in financial management, program administration, and
        maintenance of infrastructure.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD21F2FC506B34EDEB0B69E541A2A439F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (l)
                  Technical amendments
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA7B0B95A85354B7A97F40FFF67D58AA4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Public health service act definition
                     Section 2(f) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 201(f)) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and the Trust
         Territory of the Pacific Islands and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">the Federated States of
         Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H281DFB7120654388B73F08E9EDF0CBC2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Compact impact amendments
                     Section 104(e) of the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921c(e)) is amended—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4298835AA90C47239B96D1B66E55095D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in paragraph (4)—
                        
                           Time periods.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8EA518B1F6B943DBB0E1C97CA39624DF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           in subparagraph (A), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">beginning in fiscal year 2003 and
          inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">during the period of fiscal years 2003 through 2023; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7DC8B5B261CC45E4BC6FB7A94D71DE90"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           in subparagraph (C), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">after fiscal year 2003 and inserting
           <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">for the period of fiscal years 2004 through 2023;
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                        by striking paragraph (5); and

         respectively.

                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               210.
               ADDITIONAL AUTHORITIES
               
                  48 USC 1989.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDE095FAC7ACF4FF4AC76144403E982D8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Agencies, departments, and instrumentalities
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCB3A251889524C998D7C30EFBF380D82"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Appropriations to carry out the obligations, services, and programs described in
        paragraph (2) shall be made directly to the Federal agencies, departments, and
        instrumentalities carrying out the obligations, services and programs.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H24C3ADD4079245AF99EC3FEAFC02282A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Obligations, services, and programs described
                     The obligations, services, and programs referred to in paragraphs (1) and (3) are the
        obligations, services, and programs under—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H12C832309008499AA5567667F1CC87B3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        sections 131 and 132, paragraphs (1) and (3) through (6) of section 221(a), and
         section 221(b) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD741217B7CE7493BB5BF71603AC4E53F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        sections 131 and 132, paragraphs (1) and (3) through (6) of section 221(a), and
         section 221(b) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA6435F93D53B49ADBB0D332D58C75110"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        sections 131 and 132 and paragraphs (1), (3), and (4) of section 221(a) of the
         U.S.-Palau Compact;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4245707D4A784870A1FF299A8C4B0B93"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">

                        Article 6 of the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement; and
                        
                           138 STAT. 449
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2E3A4F048BAA4B529F4B85C5F2729EA8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        section 209.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA826ED950EBA4773BCD4BD82095FF499"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Authority
                     The heads of the Federal agencies, departments, and instrumentalities to which
        appropriations are made available under paragraph (1) as well as the Federal Deposit
        Insurance Corporation shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H864B7B74619E4AAB8BA7F0D0AE3C82AC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        have the authority to carry out any activities that are necessary to fulfill the
         obligations, services, and programs described in paragraph (2); and 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6549C477DB84435C8DF9BD3573F96390"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        use available funds to carry out the activities under subparagraph (A).
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6F2DE5E36F8246A5913A62BF3B321887"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Additional assistance
                  Any assistance provided pursuant to section 105(j) of the Compact of Free Association
       Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C.
        1921d(j)) (as amended by section 209(j)) and sections 205(a), 206(a), 207(b), and
       209 shall be in addition to and not charged against any amounts to be paid to the Federated
       States of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau
       pursuant to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB99AA79D826A46A4AC40CDABBDC41F3B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H72D75D08D1A64C9E8137585938473001"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3F401ED71C7E4629A11288D74AAABCE7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement; or 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1934D40B71804E038B47B2793C25E62E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     any related subsidiary agreement.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA8A1EA9B7B534C509A4119D15FB941EC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Remaining balances
                  Notwithstanding any other provision of law, including section 109 of the Compact of Free
       Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C.
        1921h)—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC6389576A0F14F4981ACFC98DC58ECAE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     remaining balances appropriated to carry out sections 211, 212(b), 215, and 217 of the
        2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact, shall be programmed pursuant to Article IX of the 2023
        U.S.-FSM Fiscal Procedures Agreement; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3EE8501647154DDC9D193D6187862713"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     remaining balances appropriated to carry out sections 211, 213(b), 216, and 218 of the
        2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact, shall be programmed pursuant to Article XI of the 2023
        U.S.-RMI Fiscal Procedures Agreement. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H97EF27FB1CB64E40AC812F51779F9C25"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Grants
                  Notwithstanding any other provision of law—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H81E06954B8BC40BFA96F0AB6964A3A3A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     contributions under the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact, the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact
        Review Agreement, and the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact may be provided as grants for
        purposes of implementation of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact, the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact
        Review Agreement, and the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact under the laws of the United States;
        and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFED35A6C95C14D9291D072A321C7A32F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     funds appropriated pursuant to section 211 may be deposited in interest-bearing
        accounts and any interest earned may be retained in and form part of those accounts for use
        consistent with the purpose of the deposit.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HACC54C2122FC417D83AE4607D29C7E7F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Rule of construction
                  Except as specifically provided, nothing in this title or the amendments made by this
       title amends the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC5095AAFE02342AABD275F67CCB9D3DF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Title I of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 (48 U.S.C. 1901 et seq.).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H089FB82E5A244851B230EFC7C26C6A39"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Title I of Public Law 99–658 (48 U.S.C. 1931 et seq.).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6BF4DD3EBCD94CF2A5D9F0221E5974EA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Title I of the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 (48 U.S.C. 1921 et seq.).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H77953308168C44BCA777C7BE03B7B970"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Section 1259C of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2018 (48 U.S.C. 1931 note; Public Law 115–91
                        
                           138 STAT. 450
                        
        ).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H861C4ABDF49A457CABB2C23DF43AD7D3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     The Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act,
        2018 (Public Law 115–141; 132 Stat.
        635).
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H253D6CA8088F46AEA3182BA85E99DE65"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Clarification relating to appropriated funds
                  
                     Grants.
                  
                  Notwithstanding section 109 of the Compacts of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003
        (48 U.S.C. 1921h)—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H359AA2B1C30B46F593DB6136B092CBE3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     funds appropriated by that section and deposited into the RMI Compact Trust Fund shall
        be governed by the 2023 U.S.-RMI Trust Fund Agreement on entry into force of the 2023
        U.S.-RMI Trust Fund Agreement;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3E3395BB75BB490C916FE3FEFF46D0AC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     funds appropriated by that section and deposited into the FSM Compact Trust Fund shall
        be governed by the 2023 U.S.-FSM Trust Fund Agreement on entry into force of the 2023
        U.S.-FSM Trust Fund Agreement;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9C4A9AEA9C5B4B52A47D0CE24D61AA0E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     funds appropriated by that section and made available for fiscal year 2024 or any
        fiscal year thereafter as grants to carry out the purposes of section 211(b) of the 2003
        U.S.-RMI Amended Compact shall be subject to the provisions of the 2023 U.S.-RMI Fiscal
        Procedures Agreement on entry into force of the 2023 U.S.-RMI Fiscal Procedures
        Agreement;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H27724858BF5D4E5DB310302DC386C331"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     funds appropriated by that section and made available for fiscal year 2024 or any
        fiscal year thereafter as grants to carry out the purposes of section 221 of the 2003
        U.S.-RMI Amended Compact shall be subject to the provisions of the 2023 U.S.-RMI Fiscal
        Procedures Agreement on entry into force of the 2023 U.S.-RMI Fiscal Procedures Agreement,
        except as modified in the Federal Programs and Services Agreement in force between the
        United States and the Republic of the Marshall Islands; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDDD7B32F946C41CA98748436CD26197C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     funds appropriated by that section and made available for fiscal year 2024 or any
        fiscal year thereafter as grants to carry out the purposes of section 221 of the 2003
        U.S.-FSM Amended Compact shall be subject to the provisions of the 2023 U.S.-FSM Fiscal
        Procedures Agreement on entry into force of the 2023 U.S.-FSM Fiscal Procedures Agreement,
        except as modified in the 2023 U.S.-FSM Federal Programs and Services Agreement.

               211.
               COMPACT APPROPRIATIONS
               
                  Time periods. 48 USC 1990.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H560B13557D234B5F84D543A32F19AEA8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Funding for activities of the Secretary of the Interior
                  For the period of fiscal years 2024 through 2043, there are appropriated to the Compact
       of Free Association account of the Department of the Interior, out of any funds in the
       Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to remain available until expended, the amounts
       described in and to carry out the purposes of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA66E8EA7738241A7B30B3C840BC4FBA5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     sections 261, 265, and 266 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF55DFB4E5F9C41AF929FB4AC6E7B612C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     sections 261, 265, and 266 of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H88CC9A25EF364B00889991D89340318C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Articles 1, 2, and 3 of the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HEE85E3F7DD534FC18CF674FD87265B10"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Funding for activities of the United States Postal Service
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8BD543F5D01241698771B8964BDC0414"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Appropriation
                     There is appropriated to the United States Postal Service, out of any funds in the
        Treasury not otherwise appropriated for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2043, $31,700,000,
        to remain available until expended, to carry 
                           138 STAT. 451
                         out the costs of the following provisions that are
        not otherwise funded:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3F6DD334BC4C4B8B833973F76603CE75"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        Section 221(a)(2) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-FSM Compact.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9336F7BE03E040799EC3E4A51833A95E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Section 221(a)(2) of the 2023 Amended U.S.-RMI Compact.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDE4A0FC3AEF54BC9B33A9D5FE3692A60"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Section 221(a)(2) of the U.S.-Palau Compact.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE0F24454501C4FD0B3A08D1EBF2CEA80"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        Article 6(a) of the 2023 U.S.-Palau Compact Review Agreement.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBAB21DAE39F1415FBA1D425AADA2A861"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Deposit
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H95D4C6A4809046A0AEAB5F40AA86E799"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        In general
                        The amounts appropriated to the United States Postal Service under paragraph (1) shall
         be deposited into the Postal Service Fund established under section 2003 of title 39,
         United States Code, to carry out the provisions described in that paragraph.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA71D454BF469499598BA68781FF24198"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Requirement
                        Any amounts deposited into the Postal Service Fund under subparagraph (A) shall be the
         fiduciary, fiscal, and audit responsibility of the Postal Service. 
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3B8DFC8570004F25B5E586147A59D33F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Funding for judicial training
                  There is appropriated to the Secretary of the Interior to carry out section 209(d) out
       of any funds in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $550,000 for each of fiscal years
       2024 through 2043, to remain available until expended. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0AA044423F044CC88442529B66EB0C6B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Treatment of previously appropriated amounts
                  The total amounts made available to the Government of the Federated States of Micronesia
       and the Government of the Republic of the Marshall Islands under subsection (a) shall be
       reduced by amounts made available to the Government of the Federated States of Micronesia and
       the Government of the Republic of the Marshall Islands, as applicable, under section 2101(a)
       of the Continuing Appropriations Act, 2024 and Other Extensions Act (Public Law 118–15; 137 Stat. 81) (as amended by section 101 of division
       B of the Further Continuing Appropriations and Other Extensions Act, 2024 (Public Law 118–22; 137 Stat. 114) and section 201 of the
       Further Additional Continuing Appropriations and Other Extensions Act, 2024 (Public Law 118–35
                     
                        138 STAT. 157
                      ; 138
       Stat. 7)). 
               
            
         
         <title id="HC01FB3D377A04ED4BB6026ACC6669350"
                 qb-display-quote="yes"
                 style="OLC">
            III
            EXTENSIONS AND OTHER MATTERS
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H8B0626390C784C63B283537D5AB70510"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               301.
               EXTENSION OF UNDETECTABLE FIREARMS ACT OF 1988
               Section 2(f)(2) of the Undetectable Firearms Act of
      1988 (18 U.S.C. 922 note; Public Law 100–649) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">35
       years after the effective date of this Act and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">on March 8,
       2031. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H946495C270264F08A28FBC1E91592273"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               302.
               UNITED STATES PAROLE COMMISSION EXTENSION
               
                  United States Parole Commission Additional Extension Act of 2024.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5248BBEA751E490FB95052431E7E6F75"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Short title
                  
                     18 USC 1 note.
                  
                  This section may be cited as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">United States Parole Commission Additional
        Extension Act of 2024.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE430386E7A7A411FB96DFAF25F13D6E1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Amendment of Sentencing Reform Act of 1984
                  
                     18 USC 3551 note.
                  
                  For purposes of section 235(b) of the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984 (18 U.S.C. 3551 note; Public Law 98–473; 98 Stat. 2032), as such section relates to chapter 311 of title 18, United States Code,
       and the United States Parole Commission, each reference in such section to <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">36 years
        and 129 days or <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">36-year and 129-day period 
                           138 STAT. 452
                        
                      shall be deemed a reference to <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">36 years and 335 days or
        <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">36-year and 335-day period, respectively. 
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC28FD354BDBE4BCDB0817BA27C69248E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               303.
               EXTENSION OF CERTAIN DIRECT SPENDING REDUCTIONS
               Section 251A(6)(D) of the Balanced Budget and
      Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (2 U.S.C.
       901a(6)(D)
                  
                     138 STAT. 164
                  
                  
                     138 STAT. 213
                   ) is
      amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC1DE8EEB5CD74D76B8BBBACC908D54A5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in clause (i), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">7 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"

         <title id="HC8DCC7B26D884152A79FFD585B60C629"
                 qb-display-quote="yes"
                 style="OLC">
            IV
            BUDGETARY EFFECTS
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H352CA9E4F58340BC93C12B4F6484BD5C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               401.
               BUDGETARY EFFECTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD08783296AAC4059AE8E69C200231CD7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Statutory PAYGO Scorecards
                  The budgetary effects of this division shall not be entered on either PAYGO scorecard
       maintained pursuant to section 4(d) of the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1B5C303DEE034B338AF9A8447C70E8C6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Senate PAYGO scorecards
                  The budgetary effects of this division shall not be entered on any PAYGO scorecard
       maintained for purposes of section 4106 of H. Con. Res. 71 (115th Congress).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H65B1CBAC6BE14D2BBB2B0AA43C597BD0"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Classification of budgetary effects
                  Notwithstanding Rule 3 of the Budget Scorekeeping Guidelines set forth in the joint
       explanatory statement of the committee of conference accompanying Conference Report 105–217
       and section 250(c)(8) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985, the
       budgetary effects of this division shall not be estimated—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H40A89EFC1B7244D0A5F5E17EB0420D57"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     for purposes of section 251 of such Act;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4B21EC51243D4341B637C74B50D13BE7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     for purposes of an allocation to the Committee on Appropriations pursuant to section
        302(a) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4628B1EF0D8D4662B336D6FD44610508"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     for purposes of paragraph (4)(C) of section 3 of the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of
        2010 as being included in an appropriation Act.
                  
               
            
         
      
   
   Approved March 09, 2024.
   
      
         
            H.R. 4366

         Sept. 14, 18-20, Oct.
         Nov. 1, considered and passed Senate, amended.

    pursuant to H. Res. 1061
         
         Mar. 8.
